author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1637069585}
review:
Sakura Fantasy: Chapter 1 was the third of a series of [strike]regretable[/strike] adult VN released here on Steam. You play as troublesome lesbian knight with the ability to farsee people in a fantasy world.

This title is overloaded with decisions but most of which have no effect other than the next 1~3 lines. Sometimes they even do things like "I decided to do A, but I thought about it did B instead". Why is the option there in the first place?! Nevertheless, there are 2 CGs which requires carefully chosing the correct options. The CGs are worth of your time, btw, the art is pretty good. The story never finishes and Winged Cloud never released the follow up - and probably never will. It is a pity since the characters are far more interesting than those presented in previous VNs by Winged Cloud. Still, this is an ecchi VN, so don't expect a lifechanging experience.

Linux port is perfect (Renpy), but no achievements. There are 36 CGs (8 are just minor variations) with a yuri H-patch, plus cards. However, since this is unfinished, I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086839230', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1634830114}
review:
[h1]Best game from Sakura series?[/h1]

I'm positively surprised how good Sakura Fantasy is compared to all other mediocre/awful Sakura games. Usually, I don't recommend anything made by Winged Cloud, but Sakura Fantasy may be exception from this "rule".

[b]GOOD:[/b]
+ Interesting and well told story. Sure, this is not something deep and there are some weird decisions here and there, but overall I was really invested in it. 
+ Enjoyable characters.
+ Great visuals - as always.
+ Uncensored patch :)

[b]BAD:[/b]
- Choices doesn't matter. It would be nice to have bigger impact on the game.
- Too short.
- Lack of ending (or rather lack of Chapter 2).

Definitely worth to give it a chance. Maybe not for the full price, but you should be able to get it in some sale or from bundle.


[i]Check my Curator's page for more reviews: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41437353-mnik%2527s-Experience/[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198350368950', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1641125406}
review:
Aside from the ero/h****i scene in the game. The story itself was not bad and actually leave a potential room for Chapter 2.

Sadly, people really underestimated this one as it has an exception of one of the few series with Female-MC and well written story. The art style is the same as Dungeon, Spirit and Angels. 

The patched version has it voiced and with extra new H scenes which is a great addition fro the game.

Although I would love to recommend this to people who are actually more interested in story. Unfortunately, Winged Cloud seemed to have kind(maybe? possibly?) abandoned Fantasy... Recommended with patch, if you are ok with yuri and don't mind a good story being left out.

review: Great Past time and nice way to get into the mood

author: {'steamid': '76561199197788644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1629642832}
review:
Sakura Fantasy takes the Sakura series to a new height, with a female protagonist, stunning soundtrack, sound effects and more choices than ever! âœ¨

The music in this one is really lovely, and so is the art. There is a CG almost around every corner, rewarding you for playing "just a little longer". Finished it in two sittings, so it definitely had me hooked! ğŸ‘€

Played on the regular Steam version, and don't feel like I missed out. Some *spicy* scenes end a little early, and boobs have no nipples, but the story itself is unharmed. A step up from the previous games, though questionable writing, characterization and grammar is still present ğŸ˜µ

The game's biggest shortcoming is the ending. It's "Chapter 1" of a story we might never see the end of, so the ending just kinda slaps you with the credits screen without any neat resolution. Still enjoyable, but it's sad that the story can't wrap up in a satisfying way ğŸ˜¥

author: {'steamid': '76561198038829342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1628213466}
review:
It's a decent short story with really nice art. I would like to see Chapter 2 released but it was canceled last time I looked. So that sucks as I'd like to see how the story ends. 

I suggest getting it on sale or in a bundle as I don't think it's worth the current price. I would also recommend getting the uncensored patch if you want the full adult experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198854185615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1621804721}
review: Really great visual novel.  Not that long and unfortunately not having a sequel but it has a really good story (probably the best from Winged Cloud) So if you want a Sakura series game with some actually good plot alongside the "plot" I would choose this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122776365', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1623103472}
review:
Una novela visual sencilla y bastante corta. La historia estÃ¡ mejor que los anteriores Sakuras, en lugar del tipico adolescente huevÃ³n rodeado de chicas sexys esta vez la protagonista es una chica sexy rodeada de chicas sexys!! (GuiÃ³n mejorado al 200%)

La historia es de fantasÃ­a medieval y se centra en un equipo de caballeritas aprendices, se torna muy lenta y algo pesada al principio sobre todo porque extienden demasiado las escenas dÃ¡ndole vueltas al mismo tema. Mejora mucho en la segunda mitad en donde las caballeritas van a los cochinos pantanos y la trama se vuelve mas interesante y por fin hay acciÃ³n.

Los personajes son muy pocos pero interesantes, los dibujos estÃ¡n muy buenos, la musiquita es relajante y me gustaron mucho las vocecitas que hacen las actrices japonesas. El tono en general es dulce con unas cuantas escenas picantes y sexys pero nada +18. (Y si, existe una versiÃ³n porno suelta en la web pero la de STEAM es para los niÃ±os buenos)

El Ãºnico defecto es que dejan la historia principal sin terminar porque supuestamente este es el episodio 1, pero nunca lanzaron una secuela.

Me gustÃ³ bastante. MÃ¡s que los otros Sakuras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198846387491', 'num_games_owned': 1088, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1607257573}
review:
Sakura Fantasy is probably one of the best VNs from the Winged Cloud's catalogue. A short fantasy story with some pleasant yuri elements.

The story, unlike most form this developer, is actually pretty decent. It creates an interesting setting and nicely written characters. Nothing extraordinaire or surprising but still decently built. Unfortunately, this is only the first part of a longer story that will most likely never conclude. From what I've heard low sales discouraged continuation. Oh, well... Still, not a complete waste of time so it might still be worth reading if you accept lack of ending.
There are numerous choices but they have little to no effect on the story. No branching paths just brief detours.

Other than story, art is probably what sells this VN. It was done by Wanaca, and done well. The quality is higher than most western VNs, both characters and CGs. Backgrounds are detailed and pretty. The 'shiny skin' effect might be the only 'defect' if you don't like such effects (nitpicking here). Well done. Number of sprites is very limited though. Wish there was more CGs as the present ones don't always match what is happening.

Music is somewhat above average. It sure fits the events and overall theme. Would listen during work or relaxing activities.

No bugs encountered.

Overall, a decently written VN with great art (my taste) and decent music. It is not a complete story though, so I'm forced to deduct some points. 6/10

review:
Antes de nada, mencionar que este es uno de los pocos Sakura que tienen parche al espaÃ±ol. Aparte del +18 como todos los otros juegos y que ambos parches son gratis y muy fÃ¡ciles de instalar, si tienes alguna duda sobre esto me lo puedes decir y te intentarÃ© ayudar cuando tenga tiempo.

El juego no tiene mucho que explicar, obviamente las visual novels no son para todos, pero si te gusta el gÃ©nero, Sakura Fantasy es la que mÃ¡s me ha gustado de momento de las que he jugado de la saga, muchas decisiones que puedes tomar pero que realmente 5 o 6 son las que hacen que pasen eventos diferentes. Voces en los personajes importantes de la historia y con una duraciÃ³n de entre 6 o 7 horas.

Si te gustan los Eroges es recomendable en su genero, sobretodo si lo pillas en alguna oferta por solo 2 euros, pero lo dicho no para todas las personas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148676717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 541, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1603732594}
review:
There is zero game play. Since this is one of those interactive novels, I really didn't expect much here. But if there isn't going to be an actual game in these things, there has to be a good story or choices that lead to different outcomes. This game only gives the choice of what skimpily clad anime character you will see. Sure, the women look like they came from a model shoot for Frederick's of Hollywood, but wear  too many clothes to make this worth getting for the nudity. And where is this game set? Evidently there is some alternate universe where the military is full of beautiful women wearing armor made by Frederick's of Hollywood. 

Save your money. No game play. No story. Too many clothes. If you are looking for nudity, there is plenty of it on the internet.

review:
The first Yuri Visual Novel of WingedCloud. Also, with an external patch, the first voiced and 18+ Visual Novel from WingedCloud. Quite a few choices, but not affecting the story to much. Overall it is pretty good and interesting. The worst part is the feeling after you finish it and realize there was never a next part, leaving the story hanging. It really didn't deserve it.

Still, one of the better WingedCloud Visual Novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1595297028}
review:
I have somewhat mixed feelings about this game. I think the main flaw is that while there were a number of choices, they don't make much difference. At least one didn't even result in a dialogue change. Others simply skip a section depending on your choice. It didn't feel like it even made a difference to how your character is perceived. 

Pros:
- Somewhat interesting story that showed promise to be interesting if it had been continued
- Good music
- The story isn't left on an 'I can't believe that just happened' type cliffhanger, so that makes the lack of subsequent chapters a bit more bearable.

Cons:
- A lot of pointless choices. I'd prefer fewer choices rather than choices there just for the sake of it.
- Incomplete. This seems to have been a chicken and egg problem. A lot of people don't buy incomplete stories. The dev has said it won't be continued because it didn't sell well.
- No voice in the patched version. There is a guide to fix this though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003786902', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1590822536}
review:
Sakura Fantasy is the third game in the Sakura Series from Winged Cloud. It shows clear improvement over the two that came before it. 

The music now appears to be real instruments instead of MIDI files, and there are a large number of sound effects also.

Sakura Fantasy is also the first game they released with a female protagonist and proper H scenes (though the steam version is censored).

The writting is far better and I found myself well drawn in. Its a damn shame that this game didnt sell well and plans to do additional chapters were cancelled. The ending of this chapter leaves you wanting more.

There are plenty of choices in this one, while most dont do much some are required to unlock different scenes so there is some replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368099358', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1588581500}
review:
[h1] Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 [/h1]

[b] Why Do I Put Myself Through This: "Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1" Edition [/b]

You know, after a while, these games all start to blend together into one total mess. The stories are never good, the art is always disappointing and bland, and they all follows similar story arcs/tropes.

In this title, you play as a novice knight or something. I made it through about 45 minutes of pure nonsense dialogue before I decided to skip to the end just so I could see some sweet, sweet "art". Thankfully, there was an uncensored patch, and I got to see so many floobies and blums everywhere...and they were all boring as well. As a straight male, a h-game has to really WORK to keep me disinterested in those aspects.

Will [b] Not Recommend [/b] this game. Nothing really happens within it, and it proved to me yet again that these games are sold firstly for the "art" (in order to support the developers or something like that), and then for the unremarkable and trash stories. Please don't buy these games...

[h2] Final Verdict: 2/10 (Bad) [/h2]

If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my curator page for my thoughts on a variety of other games!

https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37542043-ADHD-Reviews/

review:
Requires patch for restored content which you'll find at the Winged Cloud Patreon. Patches are freely accessible without being a patron or having an account.

Interesting visual novel with quite a bit of branching, although most of it is entirely irrelevant and only switches minor details in scenes, if any. Writing is decent, art too. Plus points for lots of voice acting. I don't understand japanese, but I'm sure it's great.

review: This visual novel offers a pretty good fantasy plot, which is backed up by amazing visuals. Especially if you apply a certain patch ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°)  Although I have to say they could've done a better job at changing scenes more frequently, because quite often some plot twist happens but the picture you see remains the same for a long while, even though it's irrelevant by then. Also, I'm not sure we'll ever see Chapter 2, cause it's been put on hold for a few years now. But I hope it sees the light of day sometime, because Chapter 1 was great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086614649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1578160860}
review:
Way, way, way too many choices, many of them pointless.
To the point where it's actually annoying sometimes. (considering you have to save and re-load them all, especially annoying if you forgot what you chose last time. although yes you could try using skip to check)
There are also effectively no male characters, maybe that's what you're looking for, but still. 

+The art as you can see is great
+The story is fine
+The game works fine

But I can't endorse that amount of choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285217510', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1576949366}
review:
Sakura Fantasy is the third instalment from Sakura series developed by Winged Cloud. The game features R18 content but unfortunately Steam doesn't provide a patch in the form of DLC so you have to use patch from Winged Cloud which removes all the voice acting. There is a guide to have both, the patch and the voice acting but it's pretty cumbersome and it wasn't worth my time. I did enjoy the game very much even without voice acting but I certainly recommend playing with R18 patch.

The story this time isn't that good and it is pretty clear that it wasn't the main focus of the game but is there just to give us some backdrop. It's not even complete as this is just a chapter 1 and I don't think there is chapter 2 anywhere so it might as well end up as a unfinished.

The main focus this time is on fanservice and that's even more true with R18 patch wich adds quite a lot of spicy yuri (lesbian) action in form of new scenes and uncensoring the others. There are only girls this time and our MC is also a heroine which is a fresh breath of air.

Visuals are great, all of the CG's are of very high quality and there are quite a lot of them too which is really nice for such a short (5 hours) game.

I can't comment on the voice acting since I have been playing without it but soundtrack by Zack Parrish is really good and I wish it was included as a DLC. I would most likely buy it.

Overall, my favourite Sakura game so far even though, the story is mediocre at best, I didn't mind since I don't really play VNs for story after all. 
Recommended only if you are into a yuri, otherwise, you might not enjoy this game at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412449978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1572880110}
review: Here we Are Again With Another Sakura Game haha This Time it Takes Place in Battlefield Kinda like World war sort of. The MC Reilen Prepares Herself for Whats to come Mainly Training with Dummies Instructed By Keira. Shes then Having these strange Farseeings well Call them nightmares in her Dreams where shes Being Attacked and cannot defend for herself. In doing so She wants to get rid of her Bad dream and end the cause of it So mystery Monster well Girl if you will Suddenly Attacked her And her Partner Gwynne Thinking they were Intruders. The Empress Ardena Watched over her Empire As she Wished her Faithful MC reilen Luck on her Journey. Im Not gonna spoil end lets just say She had Clean Victory haha. Give this one Read its def worth it And Good Short VN Game at that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298765390', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1560290851}
review:
Usually I don't review games that I don't like because usually I don't like them because its not my cup of tea, but the game itself might be great to someone else that is considering buying it. I won't review Factorio as bad because it isn't a first person shooter and I want it to be a first person shooter...

But I felt that I needed to have at least one bad review on my profile so I chose a game that was just plain bad and exploitative. It is bad because Sakura Fantasy is not a dating sim, it is a bait for 12 year old to buy it thinking they will see big t!tt!es. Worst of all and proving this point a little further is the fact that the dev of the game has printed out many re skins of these games, with slight changes in game play from what I found.

The game is just a lot of small talk between these unoriginal characters and is super repetitive. The player doesn't care for the characters, they are objects. The only thing the player has to look up to is the rare image of an over sexualized naked girl in mud or with burnt off clothing to stare at like a complete perv. But there is no actual nudity. Only things that come close.

I understand that a lot of people want to play these sort of games but this one has nothing that the target audience actually enjoys, only having elements to bait them in buying it so the dev makes a quick buck.

What a blue ball this sh*tty paid for game is...

Just visit an actual porn site instead of wasting your money on a long ass process to blue balling yourself.

2/10 because the game is not overly buggy there is a small audience that would still be satisfied.

And no its not exactly because of Steams terms towards game devs and mature content, because one of the best games of this genre (which does not even compare in quality) called HuniePop does feature some actual nudity when it matters.

review: It was a nice and exciting game. It's pretty sad that the story has not been continued because I'm sure it would have been a long, action-packed and fun thing. author: {'steamid': '76561198087721640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1579384900}
review: This is one of my favorites in the Sakura series.  The story is very good, art is consistently good, music is appropriate and easy to listen to, It's unique in it has a female protagonist that you get to see, setting it apart from previous Sakura titles.  My only lament is that it was set up for a sequel that never came.  Despite the story's incompletion, it's still enjoyable and worth owning.

review: As a fan of the Sakura series, this was a pleasant surprise. This VN goes beyond the regular spiciness and actually delves deep into character development and plot. There became a point where I wasn't playing for the fan service, but for the story. If they make a chapter 2, I hope it's as great as this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 3217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2776, 'last_played': 1543807727}
review:
Sakura Fantasy Review

Experience the thrilling story of a young recruit as she strives to become a knight.

Some key points that this game offers:

1.	An amazing story that keeps you pinned eagerly waiting to hear more.
2.	Beautiful scenes with gorgeous landscapes that truly capture the eye.
3.	A variety of characters to meet, all with their own unique traits and personalities. 

Gameplay & Controls: 

One can literally sit back and enjoy as the story unfolds, we have the auto play feature that lets the story move onto the next scene automatically, we can set the speed of how fast the text appears and move on to the next screen. 

Left mouse button can be used to manually click to move on to the next scene, with the right mouse button being used as the menu key. The mouse wheel can be clicked to hide the UI and furthermore, the mouse wheel can be scrolled to move to previous scenes. 

Graphics:

Every scene is beautifully crafted, brimming with vibrant colours, making them all seem so magical, truly a bliss to look at and admire. Every scene is very welcoming, you canâ€™t help but stare and admire how much detail went into creating each scene. It truly is a work of art in that regard, the characters all have their own little features and traits.

The only thing I do have to mention regarding a down side, some of the areas you move through such as the swamp. It would have been better if the same scene doesnâ€™t keep on repeating itself. But instead another swamp scene but slightly altered to actually slow progression, other than that truly a beautiful game to behold. In the menu we can choose whether to play the game in Full screen or Window mode.

Sounds:

Truly another beautiful and soothing add on to the game, the music has been carefully chosen to really set the tone for each scene, whether itâ€™s a casual meeting or something stirring that calls for some dramatic tones. Itâ€™s there and it really sets the mood for the story, the entire soundtrack truly enhances the game and overall, it really improves your experience in the game. 

What truly adds onto that and further makes the game better is the characters being voiced giving new meaning to bringing life to a book, this takes storytelling to a whole new level. Last but not least, the ambient sounds are really a hit here, there are so many of them, adding to the liveliness of this book, all of this has been masterfully combined to deliver one amazing listening experience.

Replayability:

As it stands, only chapter 1 of the game has been released. It plays from start to finish, and it does contain several different choices that you get to make as you play through it, but none of them alter the game thus far, it does unlock different scenes so for now you only have that as replay reason. 

The game does really set a high bar for the overall story which will come down to being one amazing experience with the potential for multiple endings.

MGR Gamingâ€™s Conclusions:
Spoilers ahead:

Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 has gone and set a new bar for storytelling. One which has Raelin our protagonist, a young novice aspiring to become a knight with a very unhealthy curious mind thatâ€™s got a knack for intruding on others privacy.  Having the gift of Far-seeing only adds to the mischief she enjoys causing. 

She has her entire world turned upside down when she unknowingly meets the mysterious Empress. Soon after these events occur, she is given the option to venture out into the dangerous lands beyond the capital worlds in search of another mystery. The falling star, journeys with her as she learns her own capabilities, masters her own fear and effortlessly works to keep her promise to the Empress. 

Chapter one has really set the bar high for this story and the potential for a masterpiece lies in wait here.

Score 8
By: MGRza
Date: 2 June 2015

Additional info:

Platforms: PC: Mac: Linux
Genre: Anime: Visual Novel: Indie
Censor Rating: NSFW
Age Rating: 18
Developer: Winged Cloud
Publisher: Winged Cloud
Release Date: 30 May 2015

You were training to become a knight. Then you got â€œpromotedâ€ and meet someone who changes everything. Donâ€™t worry about boys anymore, the only one in the whole game is a merchant you might come across. xb There are a lot of choices, but nothing will change the ending. You wonâ€™t have to choose between girls either, you can enjoy them all. ^.^
[h1]Story[/h1]
The story is one of the longer short VNâ€™s. It felt a bit like Sakura Agent, only a lot better. You can actually see the monsters know and you see everyone in action. Both physical and sexual. :b There is one â€œendingâ€, although this is not a real one. The story had so much potential, but it just stoppedâ€¦ because this is episode 1 and there probably wonâ€™t come a sequel. [spoiler]Now Iâ€™ll never know what the fallen star meant.[/spoiler] :(
[h1]Art[/h1]
What should I say... itâ€™s amazing! ^.^ Lots of high-resolution CGâ€™s with beautiful naked girls on different high-resolution sceneries. Almost every girl has at least one scene. But yeah, Sakuraâ€¦ :b
[h1]Extra[/h1]
The background music was nice. Most of the time they reused the same songs. But they arranged them well since it gave the right ambiance to the right moments, without feeling repetitive. The music from the swamp really creeped me out. xs
The voice acting was nice. (JP) The original nudity patch mutes the voices, but if you search well enough, youâ€™ll find a patch thatâ€™s combined. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000004658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1589056509}
review:
I've played many Sakura games and this is the first I write a negative review for, which will stand until they write Chapter 2. This game ends with a cliffhanger, many unanswered questions, and it's been 3 years with no follow up. The story it has is certainly deserving a sequel.

Do not buy this game if you care at all about the story, you will be disappointed by the abrupt ending. If you just want to see the CGs then it has nice ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088271559', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1539428839}
review:
Sakura fantasy is another Anime fantasy visual novel. It's a lot more story than it is interactive gameplay which is to be expected. This game is unique however in that it actually gives you a fairly large amount of choices that seem to feel meaningful in some scenarios (while they aren't particularly a large majority of the time). Sakura Fantasy chapter 1 is definitely as the name implies, the start of a story. Nothing too different from most other visual novels really; Cute characters with varying personalities, little bits of fan service sprinkled in here and there and ultimately this was the start of what could turn into a fairly decent and engrossing story. With boobs! Lots of em! so that's always good!

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980796094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1533579159}
review:
A Visual Novel needs three things: good art, a compelling story and natural dialogues. 
Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 delivers on all fronts, but has one BIG problem. 
The Art is Sakura standard, meaning high quality and consistency. The setting revolves around a young apprentice guard and her gift of farsight. Her friend and her trainer (all of them hot women of course) must set out to retrieve an artifact for the empress, which means leaving the walls of the city into a monster inhabited world. The scenes containing nudity sometimes are very natural, sometimes feel forced just for the sake of it. The overall story is a great hook for an epic adventure, and characters have distinct personalities with individual motivations. All a bit basic, but perfectly servicable. Dialogues run usually quite natural and are believable for the most part. The only thing that annoyed me was the emphasis on the "don't use your gift for spying on me" attitude everyone needed to express every single time a conversation started.
Here is the big problem: It's Chapter 1. It was released 2015. I think, there will not be a Chapter 2, or a proper ending. That's a shame. And for what it is, it is too expensive.

Follow my curator at https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1533704013}
review:
Tags: Adventure - VN - Visual Novel
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Sakura medieval fantasy. Very linear. No RPG elements. Storyline leads nowhere due to chapter1 only. Dont bother.

While the voice acting added a lot of flavor and inflexions, there is still only so much that can be accomplished by shifting the paperdolls around on the same set of backgrounds for so long.

The thematic was interesting, and I liked to think of it as some sort of indirect prequel to Sakura Dungeons. However, this is where I will be heading if I want more Sakura meets fantasy content. This adventure in comparison has you at the lower rank of some sort of countryside militia, with you being special in that you have a gift to have visions. So you use it to spy on, and develop a relationship with, a person close to you.

Conclusion: In the end the lack of involvement by the player really held the experience back. It is just too much passive reading. It is nice to get some fan service here and there, and at least the tone and tenor of the dialogue felt credible and somewhat dignified. If there was more gameplay to this I would give it serious consideration. As things are I will remove it for declutter however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082881386', 'num_games_owned': 1591, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1531045053}
review:
First Winged Cloud vn that have actual plot.
Really good plot actually. With nicely written characters.
Nice sprites, good backgrounds and nice music.

What is ruining the story? It's still "that kind" of visual novel. We have some serious story and suddenly: p0rn! We have well developed characters... and in next second they turn into sex toys..

It would be much better if they removed "Sakura" from title and made game without fanservice.
Instead they removed "chapter 1". Yes - this is just part of the story. And no - there will be no other parts. It sold poorly. Because lets face it - audience might have problem with story and characters here. We have strong female characters with traumatic past. It is much easier to identify with usuall main character (bland, useless and stupid male) when you are thypical reader of "Sakura" games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067935544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1575091970}
review:
Pros: 
- the art for the main characters is cute
- the backgrounds are believable, and the music is inoffensive
- if you have certain kinks, this game may be for you ... [spoiler]bondage, yuri / girl-on-girl, taking a bath in chocolate, a touch of non-com (when the MC is ambushed by a slime monster)[/spoiler]
- the story has the kernel of a good idea, but ...

Cons: 
- it is only "episode one," so there is little to no closure to be had with regards to the plot threads that are brought up.  To that end, each of the various paths (if you could call them that) all lead to the same ending.  The choices you make only seem to affect which CGs you unlock and a hint of text here or there, which is a shame.
- the world-building is OK, but the language used to describe the setting can get same-y after a while, especially with how static the backgrounds can be
- Everyone seems to have a crush on the MC, but no one can seem to act on it directly, except in the game's dream sequence
- I don't know why I was expecting anything different, but this game presents a series of events to justify skimpy clothing to be torn away and for the MCs to blush at each other, and little else. 
- The skimpiness of the armor really took me out of the experience.  The creators try to hand-wave the lack of armor with one of the characters, but again, it just really does not work for me.  [spoiler]Keira, the older knight who serves as a mentor to the MC is said to have "stone skin" and that she "rarely bothered with armor at all."  Right, and that clearly isn't just an excuse to justify the skimpy outfit in the first place...[/spoiler]

Ultimately, I felt let down by this game.  It couldn't stand on its own legs with regards to the fantasy element, because the world building and writing fell flat.  It couldn't stand on its own legs with regards to the ecchi element, because while there are teases and kissing there is little beyond that.  [spoiler]I'm told that there is a 'hentai' patch which makes the game much naughtier, even adding additional scenes / interactions; I couldn't find it one the developer's website, however, and even if I had, I don't think I would have bothered to install it.[/spoiler]   I guess if you are really into any of the kinks mentioned above, this game may be for you.  Other than that, you can safely skip this one, IMHO.

review: When i think of great authors with even greater books, I think of Steinbeck, Hemmingway, yet also SAKURA. The major nuttability granted by these games guides me through the dark when nothing else does. Not only did I get fun with my hands, but I also was motivated enough even to attempt fellating myself. Needless to say, my spine is broken now and I im in the hospital playing SAKURA. However, I'm not in the hospital because of the spine injury. No no, it's because I'm terminally ill with penile cancer. For this reason, I am a complete monster to society and cannot get any human to look at me due to the chemo and cancer culminating to my penis being in its banine state. However, I know in my heart that I'll die happy, knowing that when I do a SAKURA angel will carry me up into heaven, where I'll be able to relax with anime girls with fat tiddies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095033690', 'num_games_owned': 3274, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1528193807}
review:
*warning review may contain slight spoilers*

This visual novel made by Winged Cloud is one of the better Sakura games in my opinion. The novel tells the story about a female warrior called Raelin (yep a female protagonist), who has the ability called farseeing. One night a star drops to earth and she and her companions embark on a journey to find it.

Pros
+ Fully Japanese voiced
+ Great medieval background music
+ Rich story, can be a bit boring at certain times
+ Great visuals with well drawn characters
+ Lots of Choices, which bring slight changes to the outcome of the story
+ Female Protagonist
+ Yuri ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°)

Cons
- There is no second chapter, the game just quits at a certain point


[i]The 18+ patch disables voice, but luckily a workaround can be found [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=796230794]here[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025958586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1528047590}
review:
So, here we are reviewing another Winged Senpai Cloud visual novel/romance simulator project! I'll be brief- this was actually an interesting, well-written game that I enjoyed playing. The problem is that it sold very poorly and the company decided to put the series on "permanent hiatus" (gotta love Sakura titles and their translations!). This would be fine if it wasn't what was clearly meant to be one chapter in a saga of a story, but it is, so you're essentially reading Bernard Cornwell's [i]The Last Kingdom[/i] and ignoring the ten other novels that followed after that. Maybe it was something to do with a noticeable amount of Winged Cloud's products being complete crap (or at least Sakura Spirit was), but I guess we'll never know.

Anyway, Sakura Fantasy Chapter I is a visual novel game with the usual quality art that you get from Sakura titles (i.e. pretty good). You are Raelin, an attractive female farseering recruit in the imperial army in some medieval fantasy land. You sleep in the baracks with many other young, virile ladies and can't help but spend your nights...abusing your government registered gift of telepathy to spy on the women in your life during their most vulnerable moments...yeah. Stuff happens and you go from there.

Overall, the story is pretty good, the choice system is much better and intriguing than Sakura Spirit, and I [b]would have[/b] recommended this game...if they had followed through on the sequel(s). But I guess there's a lesson to be learned in this: namely, if you want a quality, horny visual novel presented in completion, make like Ken Williams- learn programming, figure out how to add images to your game, and hire some sleaze like Al Lowe to perfect it. 

It was an interesting game, but there will never be a sequel to this tiny slice of a vastly conceptualized story, so don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121596591', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1507178702}
review: It had a really engaging story. I was shocked.  I'm also really sad that there won't be a sequal to this particular one.  It does end on a cliffhanger, so if you care about anything [i]OTHER[/i] than giant boobs covered in chocolate, might want to give this one a pass. If that's all you want, well, here you go.  If you want boobage [b]AND[/b] story, but won't be too upset about a cliffhanger, this is right up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1524827416}
review: A visual novel set on a classic medieval setting, and this time the main protagonist is a girl. It isn't too long, but there's multiple dialogue options and a few branching paths, even if there's only one ending. It's satisfying though. The biggest addition is the Japanese voice acting. There's also a hentai patch, but that will disable the voices. It's possible to have both, but it requires some work. It's chapter 1, but a chapter 2 seems a bit unlikely. On sale is a good grab it you enjoy this stuff.

review:
[h1]Disclaimer: 
I consider my reviews harsh, as I'm very selective of what stays on this Account's library. Even though I try to go into technical categories, the review just reflects my opinion.

This review is based on the Uncensored Version of the game.[/h1]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Wanaca's Art.
    [*]Voice Acting.
[/list] 

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Lack of Character and CG variety.
    [*]Horrible story pace. 
    [*]BGM is bland and generic.
    [*]Choices make almost no difference.
    [*]Sexual Content is not very good.
[/list] 
_______________________________

Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 is the third Visual Novel of the Sakura Franchise by Winged Cloud, this third title is also stand-alone, so you donâ€™t need to play the previous titles to enjoy this one, in fact, the Sakura Series is so derivative that youâ€™re better off not having experienced any title of this series.
Sakura Fantasy is marketed on the store page as an â€œexciting visual novel fantasy adventure where you decide the development of the story by the choices you make.â€
Unfortunately, this is not really true, Sakura Fantasy is an Ecchi Visual Novel with a small amount of Sexual Encounters mixed in, but theyâ€™re neither good nor important for the plot.
The game does provide plenty of choices to make but all of them are meaningless due to the fact that they result on really brief branches that resume on the main story branch, that leads to the gameâ€™s single ending, almost immediately. In most of the choices, it even seems like the game will play both choices out regardless of what you choose or only with slight differences between the choices.

In Sakura Fantasy you assume the role of Raelin, an aspiring female knight in a medieval fantasy world of Swords and Sorcery,  the empire Raelin belongs to seems to be in decline, with the capital being the only part of the empire that managed to thrive in a blight that was currently ravaging it, and with the remaining parts of the empire becoming isolated in the blighted wilderness, against a growing number of intelligent monsters that seemingly grow in it. The first part of the game is where youâ€™re introduced to the characters one by one and where youâ€™re told about the protagonist's ability of â€œfarsightâ€ where she can make her spirit leave her body and travel to anywhere she wants and see/hear everything, so almost everyone is suspicious or antagonistic towards Raelin for being able to violate their privacy with the use of her gift.

Almost a third of the game is there to establish this setting and introducing the characters, but where this fails is on the pacing, a third of the game is roughly half an hour, this means that the story tells you what I described on the previous paragraph over the course of 30 minutes of reading, this is done so slowly because we have to endure as they talk about training, talk about farseeing, talk about training some more, have an ecchi scene in the mix, rinse and repeat.

Eventually, Raelin meets a mysterious woman in the castle who foretells of a star falling from the sky, not long after, this prediction comes true and this is where the story moves forward.
Unfortunately, the writing doesnâ€™t get really relevant until the final third of the game, which is when it starts to become interesting and the characters become competent instead of just seeming dumb, narrow-minded characters. 
It's at this point, when youâ€™re starting to enjoy the story that it ends, and in an unsatisfactory cliffhanger.

This is the first release in the series that features a female protagonist, men in this title are barely seen and of no importance, relegated to a background role in order to fill the world, this makes the game Yuri focused, and while I enjoy Yuri scenes, story wise it seems odd that other than generic guards, no one in empireâ€™s army is male, even scouting parties with important missions mentioned on the game were all female, are men weak in this realm? Is the empire Matriarchal? Have men been killed? Weâ€™re never told, this could have been fixed simply by removing one ecchi scene on the first part of the game and invest a bit more on proper world building.

Compared to the previous two titles, Sakura Fantasy did receive more attention and polish, there are no bugs I caught and no grammatical and spelling errors, the user interface seems cleaner too. Inconsistencies between what is being shown and what is written is also less noticeable so at least it seems they were paying attention to some of the weak points of their previous titles.

Concerning the sound, the BGM  is bad. It is a generic fantasy-style soundtrack, it never feels memorable and sometimes it even sounded out of place with what was going on.
The game features sound effects but they are few and rarely utilized, many scenes would have benefited from the inclusion or more sound effects.
The game does feature, Japanese voice acting, which from what I gather is not cheap, so that's a plus.

The character art is great and a joy to see, Wanacaâ€™s art still is the strongest point of the series. 
Not everything is great though, the character designs suffer from being too identical, more so if youâ€™ve played previous titles, and the event graphics look like pin-up shots that could have benefited from several variations of the same image to give the illusion that action is taking place while improving the visual feedback from what is written.

The game drives you into a lot of ecchi scenes with nudity and thereâ€™s also four sex events, they were not very good or enjoyable and suffered from the same static pin-up art for almost the entirety of event, the only one I enjoyed had three different CGs, the other three events only had two CGs.

[h1]Final Thoughts:[/h1]
Sakura Fantasy is roughly one hour and thirteen minutes long depending on how fast you read, the story seems interesting but the pacing is so slow that it is a chore to read, even the ecchi scenes become uninteresting after awhile. Iâ€™m not entirely sure of who Sakura Fantasy target audience is, but there are much better titles with great story with lots of fanservice or sexual content to pick up and localized in english, like Edelweiss(MangaGamer), Deus Machina Demonbane(Jast USA), Princess Waltz(Jast USA), Brave Souls(Jast USA), Kyonyuu Fantasy(MangaGamer) and Muv-Luv(Steam) to name a few.

As with previous Sakura titles, Sakura Fantasy is not a completely lifeless work thereâ€™s unachieved potential here, it improved on previous titles but only with superfluous visual eye candy to stand on, I canâ€™t recommend this series.

[h1]The Fantasy series was officially dropped, so we may never see an episode 2.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198094129268', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1516566007}
review: I would recommend this game to anyone that enjoys fantasy stories.  The story starts by just dropping you into the middle of the story and helps you catch up with what is going on.  I would say that the stories in the Sakura series that have female leads tend to be more interesting and the protagonists tend to be less simple.  This game is definitely one of them as Raelin has an interestng personality.  The story wraps up well towards the end but leaves it so the second chapter is wanted and will continue the story nicely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078973022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1515122575}
review:
A well designed story! Longer than I have expected and fun to read. You play 
a young female knight in a fantasy world. On her guard duty she gets more
information about the political side of the capital than the other knights.: People
are no longer save, there are far too less guards and the monsters seem to be
intelligent. One day the empress herself asks the female knight to go on an expedition
from which she may not return: Three brave female knights get on the mission to
reach a fallen star. Maybe each one's 'gift' like farseeing could help to stay alive ...
Well written, yuri-elements (same-sex love interest), funny and serious. Sadly,
Chapter 2 has been put on hold permanently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269668096', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1508760780}
review:
+Story is really captivating, with a lot of background stories.
+Great diversity in characters, all with different traits and personalities. Every character has an interesting backstory, and they all play a different role in the story.
+Simply LOVE the CG's. Especially with the special patch (available on their patreon), it gets really fun :).
+A lot more choices than other Winged Cloud games.
+You play a character with her own motivation and you can actually see her in nearly all the CG's (especially great with the patch). It makes the story so much better, normally you just play an invisable guy.
+Calm music and the voices are pretty good.
-Too short. You can make all the different choices and pass all routes in roughly an hour, which is pretty quick. It would've been better if the game was in a pack with multiple chapters, but as a standalone game it just isn't enough.
-Still no chapter 2, PLS WINGED CLOUD GIVE US THE NEXT CHAPTERS

author: {'steamid': '76561197985206449', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1511983595}
review:
Yet another Sakura game I got from a Humble Bundle (only got a couple more to try out), this being the third in the series but again, just like the previous "gamesâ€, it shares no connection, either in characters or lore, with previous titles.
Yes again, there is plenty of cleavage on show (there is also two 18+ patches, one for adult content and another for adult content and extra scenes).
But let me get straight out and say it, the previous games where a "glad I didn't buy this bundle for this game" and this one..... is actually on the fence.
If I was buying the $1 tier for this game, I would actually consider it money well spent, I would even be tempted to say it was in the higher $5 tier I wouldnâ€™t have been upset at getting this game.
As this time, there is choices, plenty of choices for you to "shape" the story, I say shape, tongue in cheek, because once you play back through you find that most of choices only effect a few lines of dialogue but still on your first play-through, unless I'm just so overjoyed from the complete lack in the previous games, it was great to feel involved in the story this time.
Also previous games, you where an invisible bloke, in both cases, completely lacking personality, maybe because you where meant to put yourself into the story but the dialogue your character would say, just had me cringe and ruin any chance of that. This time, you control, well maybe control is the wrong word, this time, you follow the adventure of a young lass in this world. Which makes it much more interesting, as you can read what she thinking and how sheâ€™s reacting as if you reading an actual book.
Of course the biggest let down, is still the limited number of backgrounds, would really help, with this being a visual novel if the scenes changed to fit the text abit more often.
So why the down vote?
Well unlike in previous games, where the story has concluded but (especially in the first game), you could quite easily see that story be expanded upon by a sequel.
In this game, this is only part of the story, it quite clearly even says so in the title "Chapter 1".
The problem is as of writing this, this game is few years old (2015 it was released) and after a quick search, though a sequel was in development it seems to have quietly been canned or at the very best shelved for the time being.
And it's not like the series has been axed, as according to Wiki, there is about another 8! Sakura games that have been released since this game.
So even though this is the best Sakura game I've played so far, with the most interesting story yet, the build-up had me really engrossed in the story, the previous games it was, lets get this over with, this time I was actually looking forward to seeing what happens next, as the main characters have all been fleshed out with interesting backgrounds.
It's the fact that as of right now, this is only the start of the book, personally it feels like this would have been, or should have been aleast a trilogy and this chapter 1 is only the first third of the book. And with no signs of any sequels, it maybe the best Sakura game I've played so far, but no-one wants to get into a story only to be left wondering what happens next, hence yet another down vote. If they finish the story, then I'll happily change this to a thumbs up, as long as you get in a sale or something, only took me 2/3 hours in total and that was adding on the extra content when I came across it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273011256', 'num_games_owned': 3040, 'num_reviews': 715, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1511575270}
review:
[h1](oYo)[/h1]

Pues... a diferencia del promedio de las novelitas de la serie sakura, esta tiene una historia mas decente y pulida ademas de que no es un harem generico como las demas; encarnas a Raelin una "soldado/caballera" novata que se tiene que embarcar en una mision peligrosa derivada de un evento cosmico.

>Lo bueno:
-La historia esta decente y mejor lograda (para este tipo de titulos)
-contenido nsfw (con el parche 18+)
-Buena actuacion de voz (con el parche)
-Yuri

>lo malo:
-no tiene logros (un fail en este tipo de "juegos")
-y la secuela? wtf

[h1]Resumiendo:[/h1]
Pues... como siempre digo en este tipo de "juegos" consideralo dependiendo de que tan lector seas y si no tienes problemas con las historias bobas de todo contenido ecchi promedio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 617, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1511341813}
review:
[list]
[*] [strike]Second-rate writing and grammar, though the concept of the plot is at least interesting even if takes a lot from other existing media franchises, namely Attack on Titan.[/strike]
[*] [strike]Plot elements are sometimes inconsistent.[/strike]
[*] [strike]The build-ups in dramatic moments are terrible, even during the erotic moments that are the most focused on.[/strike]
[*] [strike]Many typos.[/strike]
[*] [b]Has yuri scenes.[/b]
[*] [strike]The yuri scenes are short and feel like they're forced in just for the sake of being a yuri VN.[/strike]
[*] [strike]Voice acting was added a year after release and they didn't bother matching the text & voices to feel more consistent, making some dialogue much longer than the text and vice versa.[/strike]
[*] [strike]The official link for the H-patch is gone so you'll have to search around online for mirror links.[/strike]
[*] [strike]The H-patch bugs some dialogue to not play at all or are missing the voice files entirely.
[/strike]
[*] [strike]Has "Chapter 1" in the title but there apparently will be no Chapter 2 due to poor sales of this particular title supposedly.[/strike]
[/list]

These "Sakura" VNs are throw-away novels; you get these games just for the ecchi stuff even though you can pretty much find all the "extra CG" images online for free. 
Despite there being better VNs out there that have better writing and even better H-scenes than the low-tier ones here, weebs will flock to these games regardless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202022263', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 434, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1510396664}
review:
[h1] Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 [/h1]

This game immediately throws players into a world where castles and knights are a common place. Not only that, but thereâ€™s a small degree of magic thrown into the mix. Everyone has their own skill and must learn to master it just as they would any other battle skills. 

Our protagonist, Raelin, sheâ€™s got the ability to â€œfarsee.â€ With this she can see through the eyes of other people whenever she darn well pleases, which leads to a heck of a lot of spying on her fellow knights at private times. She basically manages to get into situations where girls are severely underdressed with and without farseeing. But hey, thatâ€™s what these Sakura games are known and loved for, am I right!?

In any case, the story picks up once Raelin meets with a mysterious woman in the castle who foretells of a star falling from the sky. Lo and behold, this prediction comes true, I won't go into depth with this due to the fact of spoilers.

WARNING!!! This game does end on a cliff hanger but they are in the process of the second chapter so hold on to your [spoiler] dicks [/spoiler] or whatever you have!

Despite the sudden ending i'm still giving this game a 7.5/10 rating!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075000834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1514126509}
review:
tl;dr: Excellent game.  Good story, bland characters, plus boobs.  9/10

This is the third Sakura game released by Winged Cloud.  After the time I put into it, which was not accurately recorded by Steam (as I lost internet connection without realizing it), I can see why this is considered to be the pinnacle of the Sakura games.

PLOT:

In order to explain many of my feelings on the plot of the game, I'm going to have to delve into spoilers.  THIS IS YOUR WARNING!  IF YOU DO NOT WANT ANY PLOT SPOILERS, PLEASE SKIP TO THE "ART" SECTION OF THIS REVIEW.  SPOILER ALERT!

The story takes place throught the eyes of Raelin, a knight in training, also known as a Novice, inside the walls of the last major city in the empire.  A sickness has claimed much of the land, turning into a hostile, monster-riddled environment.  While her training is going on, she is assigned to guard duty in the castle.  It is there where she meets the Empress Ardena, and is told a prophecy of a falling star.  That evening, a metor falls from the heavens, and Raelin, her instructor Keira, and her friend and barracks scribe Gwynne trudge out into the infected lands to retreive it.  They go a night in the forrest, and meet up with a village of natives.  One native, Ethy, assists them in their journey.  The village is attacked, and Raelin saves the day.  As exciting as that is, that is where the game ends.  As you will see, this is "Chapter 1" in what i assume was meant to be a series.  Since this game was released in 2014, and there have been no mentions of any sequel to this game, I have to judge the plot based on what I have.

The writing for scenes and characters is great, but not incredible.  The scenery and world are well fleshed out, but some of the characters can come off as stiff or just extraneous.  Gwynne, for example, has one scene where she wants Raelin to discover the fate of a library she worked at.  Raelin tells her that the library is gone, and that's the end of that interaction.  Gwynne spends the rest of the game basically whining, which is in great contrast to the hard worker the game wants you to believe.  Keira spells out her entire motivation over a campfire, in a scene that starts with basically a line akin to "I'm sure you want to hear this."  It's unfortunate that the character writing is so lacking in contrast to the way the plot scenarios are explained.  i felt like something was a stake here.  However, since it ends so abruptly, it's hard to be satisfied with the plot by itself.

ART (SPOILERS END HERE):

Sakura Fantasy is the first in the series of games to include an explicit patch.  It's available on Winged Cloud's Patreon (https://www.patreon.com/wingedcloud).  I installed the patch (don't judge me), and I will be basing my opinions of the art that is included in the patch.  It's the same artist as the last two games in the Sakura series/franchise (Spirit and Angels), and I only see improvement over the last two games.  The colors are bright, the characters aren't rediculous, and the explicit, pornographic scenes are well drawn.  Anime art styles in games are hard to convince people on because it's such an acquired taste.  I personally like the art, and the addition of explicit scenes were a nice treat for the eyes...among other things.

MUSIC:

The music in Fantasy was adequate at best.  Personally, I was more engrossed with the writing to listen to the music.  It wasn't as upbeat as the soundtrack from Angels, but it wasn't so offensive or bad for me to mute.  i suppose it gets a pass.  Also on the topic of sound, the game's voice acting (which is also decent) is disabled by installing the explicit patch.  Just an FYI.

OVERALL EXPERIENCE:

Sakura Fantasy was a joy to play through.  I was fully engaged in the narrative, and I'm quite disappointed that there will not be a sequel coming out.  Aside from the flat-ish character writing, I liked the idea of not playing as a faceless main character-kun, but as a character with her own abilities and motivations.  It makes the narrative a more 3rd-person, rather than 2nd-person perspective.  I can see why now that Sakura Fantasy is considered the Zenith of the franchise.  Not a single moment had me groaning or laughing.  It was serious, but not to the point where it was uncomfortable.  This is not a game to skip, weather or not you're a fan of the franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009986252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1546056793}
review:
The Sakura series games can be hit or miss for me, but this one I enjoyed quite a lot. This review is from having played chapter 1.

The art was of course good, that's never been a low point in any of Winged Cloud's titles in my opinion. The soundtrack was pretty agreeable too for me so no complaints there either. Good work artists and musician(s) folks!

The story was pretty interesting what little there was in this first chapter, and the setting was developed well compared to some of the past Sakura game entries, so I was pleased to see that.

The characters were pretty good so far too, and I think the mystique carried especially by one in particular key character who I will not name here to prevent spoilers, was great to slowly unravel. I'm sure it will be a feature of subsequent chapters as well.

The adult content scenes were mostly fun and enjoyable except for one that I didn't care for. But thankfully that unfavorable-to-me scene was quite optional and they made it more difficult to get than the others. You'd have to be (un)lucky to have gotten it on your first playthrough. SPOILER: [spoiler]The scene in question was the sex scene with the purple sucubus-like unbeatable slime lady that attacks the party when they reach the remains of the holy site. It was basically non-consentual sex, and that's not enjoyable to me personally.[/spoiler]

Overall though, it's definitely been one of the more enjoyable of Winged Cloud's Sakura series games of the few that I have played, even with the lack of conclusion that naturally comes with only being chapter 1 of a larger story at the time of writing this review.

review: I expect something more when it comes to fantasy setting, which sadly wasn't really interesting in this game. What's worse, it's not completed story and plans for the sequels are cancelled. Maybe the biggest fans of Winged Cloud will enjoy it, but if you play Visual Novels once per few months, you will be bored with this one. Also, the voices aren't working with uncensored patch. I really wanted to get into Sakura games but somehow it wasn't a good start point, so be careful.

Media novela (sin exagerar) es la prota teniendo sueÃ±os hÃºmedos con las demÃ¡s o escenas del tipo que la prota va en busca de alguien a su habitaciÃ³n: Si tocas antes de entrar, desbloqueas la imagen de la otra chica con ropa; y si no tocas, la pillas cambiÃ¡ndose...

Las elecciones que haces, no cambian absolutamente NADA de la trama. Algunas, desbloquearan una u otra escena de la galerÃ­a (lo mejor es coger guÃ­a porque algunas son enrevesadas).

My very first though on this game: 
450 MBs... and 32 Art pics... jeez...
After playing it for a while I begin to realize that this is probably
the best Sakura game by far...
It's got voice, incredible drawings and the most pleasing music
from all Sakura Games that my ear could hear.
Infact the music is so beautiful that I couldn't make any progress in the game,
just right after the very first Soundtrack in the game xD
it's style reminds me of the OSTs from the Anime 'Aria' which is also very pleasing.
But I guess whats surprising me the most, is the the fact that we are acutally
playing a female char. Mostly the protagonist is always male XD
Whats annoyning me though is the translation from Jap into eng.
Its just so cringey at some points, where I myself would even make a better one!
And the repeating congress-scences are just boring af.
This then quickly turned my first impression of this game upside down.
From seemingly one the best sakura games to probably one of the lamest by far.
I mean seriously. Is that what you call adventerous Fantasy?
Whats sure though is that this is the sakura game 
where the most effort has been put into.
This is also a great example to show that not everything where a lot of effort
has been but into, must be actually good.
And then all the tention on that dumb comet is just annoying.
Also: Not even the half of all IMGs were 'usefull' at all.
Whats good tho is the adventure in the last part of this game,
I really enjoyed it. But then again the fact that it goes on in chapter 2 is annoying.
(Raelin best girl)

review:

Length: Very Short (1-2 Hours)

My only gripe is the fact volume 2 may never be released which is a shame. (also where the story ended)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024969911', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1504964156}
review:
So to start with the big negative: Sakura Fantasy is not and never will be complete. Which is a shame as it actually had a genuinely interesting story with plot and everything.  



It does have the kind of anctics you would expect from a Sakura game -- there are the usual situations of walking in while people are changing, slime monsters that like to dissolve clothing, vine monsters that like to rip off clothing, genuinely dangerous monsters which damage clothing while trying to kill the girls, ... etc



There is a patch that adds some Yuri (lesbian) scenes in the form of dream sequences. The main plot of the story is set, but your choices affect who you dream about for the extra scenes, and there is one girl that you could miss if you don't have the correct set of choices. 



Overall, this one is recommended -- but not at full price, and be warned that it just kind of peters out as it is unfinished. (plotwise it seems to be about 1/3 complete)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048817935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1505817798}
review:
[h1][i]ChissÃ  cosa dicono le ragazze con le tette grandi quando mi parlano.[/i]
-tremenoventi, Twitter[/h1]

Quando dici Sakura c'Ã¨ chi pensa a Sakura di Naruto, chi a Card Captor Sakura e infine a chi pensa alle varie visual novel erotiche.

Sakura Fantasy Ã¨ una visual novel ambientata nel classico mondo fantasy fatto di castelli, guerrieri e magie. La nostra protagonista, Raelin Ã¨ una recluta dotata di un potere alquanto insolito: la capacitÃ  di poter vedere altri luoghi distanti anche chilometri. Tralasciamo il dettaglio che lei lo usa per spiare le ragazze mentre si spogliano. La sua vita da recluta cambia quando un giorno assiste a un evento straordinario, una stella cadente.
CosÃ¬ Raelin insieme alle sue amiche partirÃ  in una missione che ha come scopo quello di rintracciare la stella cadente.

Purtroppo i ritmi della storia sono piuttosto blandi e lenti e inoltre cosa piÃ¹ importante e grave: questo Ã¨ solo il primo capitolo. E resterÃ  almeno per un bel po' l'unico capitolo disponibile. Infatti gli sviluppatori non soddisfatti delle vendite hanno deciso di abbandonare la serie lasciandola incompiuta dopo un solo capitolo anche se questo dura sulle 3 orette buone.

Sia le musiche sia la grafica sono tutto sommato soddisfacenti, mentre il contenuto erotico (non vi scordate che c'Ã¨ una patch 18+!) Ã¨ buono, specie se apprezzate molto il genere yuri (termine che indica una relazione omosessuale tra due donne). Inoltre Ã¨ da sottolineare la quantitÃ  di scelte, che in alcuni casi determinano le scene sbloccate (cosa che favorisce la rigiocabilitÃ ).

E quindi, il giudizio finale? Non Ã¨ positivo, anche perchÃ© se la visual novel nel comparto tecnico ed erotico Ã¨ ok, sottolineo che comunque la trama riveste un ruolo importante. E non c'Ã¨ niente di peggio di assistere ad una trama molto banale e soprattutto incompiuta. 

Lo consiglio solo in forte saldo o in qualche bundle (come ho fatto io).

Voto: 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198046820978', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1505796904}
review:
A huge step forward in story quality and decisions to be made compared to the previous Sakura game. (Sakura Angels) Voice acting is present, however the game is still 720p in resolution. 

Pros:
An actually well written story. There are much more decisions you can make compared to Sakura Angels, the game before this. There are Yuri scenes, most of them dreams though (the other party dreams it as well due to the protagonist gift, so they kind of, did it?).  Background scenes change as they should when the dialogue talks about it (Night) and the music fits well with the atmosphere of the story and is well mastered. 
 
Cons:
Itâ€™s not finished. We never know what happens in the end. The story cuts of short. Did I mention that this is a 2015 game with a resolution of 1280x720? For the art as well? Most of the decisions you make gives you the same or similar answer as the other or goes back to the other decision's answer because the decision you made had nothing going for it. 

- A disappointment baited by humble chan

author: {'steamid': '76561198031474038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1505224415}
review:
A story about a young woman who sets out on a dangerous quest.

This visual novel offers more choices than other titles in the series. They don't really change the outcome of the story, rather they just let you get it on with different people.

The fanbase for this title will appreciate it, as it is made completely for them. People who don't really see the appeal of anime fanservice can move on.

review: In terms of works of art, this is right up there with the Sistine Chapel ceiling. If the Sistine Chapel ceiling was only halfway finished and was about anime girls getting it on. I've only read like 3 of the Sakura games to the end, but this is probably the best one. This is only chapter one however, and chapter 2 seems like it's either in development hell or maybe it's just been straight up canceled. I think it's good, but I cannot recommend getting it as it end on a cliffhanger that looks like it'll never be resolved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094737880', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1505075688}
review:
[h1] tldr: Sakura Fantasy is a masterpiece. Every single aspect of this game is groundbreaking in some way or the other, proving that games can be smartly written without sacrificing the quality in other areas.

sakura fantasy [/h1]

The Sakura Series is often overlooked by people dismissing them as joke games. Joke games to feature on their profile to go â€œhey im such a weeb whos into hentai lolâ€ or to gift to their friends. Yet if that were the case, why are the review scores so high? The Sakura games are indeed great games deserving of their review scores, and there are several reasons.

[h1] a cult classic story [/h1]

Sakura Fantasyâ€™s story is not just one of the best fantasy stories ever told, but one of the most provocative and ambitious stories of all time, period. The story is indeed cleverly written; itâ€™s smug enough to know what it is and have fun with it, and smart enough to play with tropes and cliches by subverting subversions of tropes by completely obeying the tropes and cliches. 

As with any fantasy story, Sakura Fantasy is one with memorably amazing characters, of which Sakura Fantasy has plenty. Each of the characters is impossible to hate, no matter how many times they showcase the same trope over and over and over again. Each of them shines brilliantly with the whole time they develop, and each of the characters are just as great as the characters from something like Seinfeld, the greatest anime of all time.

[h1] addictively fun and tense gameplay [/h1]

The gameplay in the Sakura series has very rarely dared to defy what they are, because it is downright impossible to improve on what they are. The gameplay is simplistic. Basic. But infinitely addictive with so many possibilities that leave you wanting more. Reading text, clicking, reading more text, then picking one of two options. Downright impossible to improve on. So many possible outcomes; with just 12 times to pick, you have over 4000 possible combinations. They come by so suddenly that youâ€™re always on the edge of your seat, waiting to click one of the two choices. And when itâ€™s done, you get to do it over again.

[h1] stylish graphics [/h1]

(serious)
So like my Sakura Nova review, this is one giant sh*tpost. I only got these games because of Humble Bundle, Hurricane Irva relief or whatever the hell itâ€™s called, and shits and giggles. But just like Sakura Nova, credit where credit is due; the CG artwork is really good. Well drawn, high-quality artwork that go suspiciously close to hentai but just enough to not get pulled. I wouldnâ€™t mind having some of the...err, tamer ones as a wallpaper.
(/serious)

[h1] so basically [/h1]

Sakura Fantasy is a blend of elements that would hold the fort on their own, but are so invariably intertwined that they are all integral to why Sakura Fantasy is a downright masterpiece. Sakura Fantasy is a groundbreaking blend of simplistic yet fun gameplay leaving you at the edge of your seat, an ambitious story that succeeds at what it tries, and a set of graphics that present everything in an amazingly stylish fashion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053942751', 'num_games_owned': 4652, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1505069704}
review:
Game: Sakura Fantasy
Genre: Visual Novel
Publisher/Developer: Winged Cloud
System: Steam (PC)
Total Score: 81/100
Value Score: 8.1/10

Length of Playthrough: 2 Hours

â€¢ Story: 8/10
â€¢ Characters: 8/10
â€¢ GamePlay: 7/10
â€¢ Graphics: 9/10
â€¢ Sound: 9/10
â€¢ Music: 8/10
â€¢ Length: 6/10
â€¢ Replay Value: 7/10
â€¢ Player Value: 9/10

[u]Pros[/u]
+Colorful cast of characters
+Great background designs
+Decent OST
+Gallery mode which allows you to see CG scenes
+Uncensored (though it showed nudity, some parts were cleverly hidden purposely)
+Voiceovers for the main characters
+Choosing different choices lead to different CG scenes

[u]Cons[/u]
-Kinectic visual novel
-FPS stutters constantly between 20 FPS to 60 FPS though its barely noticeable through text loading (tested on both laptop and desktop)
-Voiceovers are only in Japanese
-Story ends in a cliffhanger

review:
Step 1: Spend a dollar at the Humble Bundle, make sure 100% of it goes to charity
Step 2: Get games for less than 15 cents each
Step 3: Play the game and try not to laugh at how ridiculous it is
Step 4: Keep in mind the games normally cost 10 dollars each, and you got it at a 99% discount
Step 5: Idle the game until you have all the trading cards
Step 6: Sell the trading cards, worth more than the price you paid for the game
Step 7: Profit! (although you may risk being called a pervert)

For extra giggles, read the reviews. Some people have a good sense of humor.

Interesting game. Never knew they used plate bikinis in combat in Japanese history. Makes sense.

There are many options in the game, and there may be a lot of endings. My English is poor, I rely solely on translation software.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249190728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1495744921}
review:
I was amazed at the depth of the story.  The character design is amazing and varied, and every encounter with the characters ends in a different way.  There is actual character development as the story progresses.  Backstory gets thrown in for good measure, but this never makes it boring.  The music is a good accompaniment to the adventure, and fits the mood of each scene.  
There are no boring parts.  It's a memorable masterpiece that leaves players dreaming about their lovers in another realm long after it's over.  
And that's why the game is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037735248', 'num_games_owned': 9457, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1497732538}
review:
Meh.  I think I got this in a bundle, otherwise, please chalk it up to drunk-VN'ing.

"Plot" aside, there's not enough plot in Chapter 1 to be interesting.  Perhaps if they'd actually put a whole story for sale instead of going with the Green Mile serial design, I'd end up interested.  Instead I ended up wishing for more chocolate.

3/>    (Look sideways.)

Still, meh.
