author: {'steamid': '76561198047454451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1485839026}
review:
Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 has an absolue buttload of content, porn, and endings. for the gentlemen or ladies with stronger dominant arms, there will be a lot of quicksaves to get all of the *ahem* [i]scenes[/i]. The story in this game in particular will appeal to fantasy lovers, and the wonderful voice acting and music is also a nice touch to the more recent sakura games. this is one of the better "I just want to fap" games out of the series, so for porn buyers, grab some tissues and get that uncensored patch rolling.

overall, if you are buying this for the porn and want to support the winged cloud team, do it. but if you are looking for a SUPER SERIOUS DRAMA FILLED ROMANCE VISUAL NOVEL avoid all sakura games. these VNs are meant to be enjoyed and give a comedic feel like a rom/com ecchi anime, not taken as seriously as a Triple-A title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1491253087}
review:
Quick little game with an interesting plot... of sorts. While it does end on a cliffhanger (as at one point, at least, it was supposed to be the first chapter of a longer tale), the story is nice enough that you can be satisfied with the conclusion. And if you are into trading cards, you can take acquire those, too.

There is also a patch to allow the CGs to be more revealing... though I'm not sure it really adds anything to the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006413390', 'num_games_owned': 3172, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1540230461}
review:
[h1]Review with accompanying video on Sinical Network[/h1]

https://www.sinicalanimenetwork.com/post/2018/10/22/sakura-fantasy-review

This 3rd title of the Sakura series from Winged Cloud features Raelin, a young aspiring novice knight with a special gift in farseeing who is training together with her best friend Gwynne, a fellow novice knight and scribe under their instructor Keira. One night, a falling star landed in the Mires. Afterwards, the empress Ardena came to seek out Raelin to find the fallen star together with Gwynne and Keira. Over the course of the story, Raelin with interact with Gwynne, Keira, Ardena, a young native Ethy, an unnamed guardsman, a slime and tentacle monster and a siege monster in a heart-warming tale of friendship, love, courage, resourcefulness, and heroism.
 
The story and plot is written like a romantic comedy with a share of humour and fan service. As one of the earlier visual novels in Steam back in 2015, Sakura Fantasy is one of those few visual novels to bring adult yuri content (an uncensored patch is available for download at the developer's Patreon page for the Steam version) and voice acting back when there were very few such visual novels in Steam during that time period. In addition, the game has great artwork by Wanaca in the game and soundtrack cover, CGs, Steam badges and profile backgrounds making it attractive to showcase on profile. The background music by Zack Parrish are also great by containing a mix of pleasant and stirring piano, wind, and string instruments which are appropriate for the medieval fantasy themes in the story.
 
I chose the protagonist of this visual novel to be my waifu (favorite female character) and avatar at Sinical Network because she is a plucky heroine who is also beautiful, cute, funny, resourceful, and loyal to her friends and lovers.
 
Sadly, this game ended on an unfinished ending with very little hope for a sequel where the expedition did not reach the fallen star and there was also an undeveloped plot hook involving Keira's missing sister. To make matters worse, the voice actresses featured in this game has been reported to have parted ways with Winged Cloud making this game the last visual novel to ever feature voice acting among all of Winged Cloud's games. [i]Sakura Angels[/i] and free to play clicker game [i]Sakura Clicker[/i] are the other two titles that include voice acting.
 
Despite its premise as a short visual novel with fanservice and adult yuri content that will only take a few hours to read and listen through, Sakura Fantasy is one of Winged Cloud's best visual novels to date with an endearing female protagonist where every main female character genuinely cares about her and is protective of her in the entire visual novel. It also has great voice acting, artwork, and background music to make this visual novel stand out and remain an unforgettable classic among many of Winged Cloud's other titles. For those who don't mind the unfinished ending, controversies, and short length of this visual novel, this game is highly recommended when at a very attractive discount or bundle offer of a few dollars in price at most.

I have also written an e-mail to Winged Cloud to ask for Sakura Fantasy Chapter 2 to be released at some point in future.

[h1]Visual novel, JRPG, Anime Steam group - Join the group and consider following the group's curator list for more reviews, romantic comedies or games with great artwork[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/vnislife

author: {'steamid': '76561198025047055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1541655856}
review:
Short yuri VN thats graphic but not emitioal. Choices don't seem to matter, and it seems very unfinished. The sound and art are pretty good, but there isn't much else I care for here: it needs more and better writing and/or some interesting gameplay.

Sakura Dungen was much the same, except with 5X the content, a better story and characters and and stuff to do (its an auctual dungen crawler game with combat).

I figured I'd try Sakura Fantasy since Sakura Dungen was auctually pretty good, but I don't think its worth the time. Not horrible, but its little more than a vessal for some erotic yuri scenes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019823270', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1527268720}
review: It's a Sakura game.  If you like Sakura games you'll probably like this one.  So far this is the best I've personally played.  Buy it on the cheap, enjoy the not completely terribly written story, and move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023670440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1479851373}
review:
There's a saying.  Fool me once, shame on you.  Fool me twice, shame on me.

Well, I only have myself to blame in that case.

I'd like to point out that this review was written an hour into the game.  If it gets better after that point then fine, but I'm just not interested after an hour of playing.

None of the characters are interesting.  At all.  I have no idea what anyones general goal is at this point (other than Maybe Kieras?  And that's a pretty good maybe.), but I do know nobody likes Raelins ability to farsee.  I know this because no one will fucking shut up about it.  It feels like it's brought up at very strange times that make no real sense (Thanks for the compliment.  By the way, don't fucking spy on me bro.).

The game gives you more choices than Sakura Fantasy did.  Sadly, they don't seem to make any sort of difference.  More than once, I've basically had "Do the stupid thing" and "Don't do the stupid thing", and all it really does is delay the inevitable when I pick the obvious option.  I could understand "Daydream" and "try not to daydream", but when your choices are "Check in on her" and "Knock on her door" and both lead to option one, it kinda makes it ridiculous when the naked pissed off woman says "you shouldn't have done that".

I honestly can't bring myself to recommend this to anyone.  If all you want is anime tiddy, just google it and save yourself the trouble of boring characters and a boring story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1472005156}
review:
Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 is a Japanese anime Visual Novel. This story is an medeval fantasy story with an "eroge" Yuri harem. You actually play a female warrior and you see your character throughout the VN.
I thought it had very good, understandable, funny and interesting story. It has great artwork, japanese voiceovers, english subtitles, animation, music and sound.  It has a free hentai patch, wow nice extra hentai material, uncensored xxx.  It is a cliche anime story, characters and fanservice.  The many choices don't really change the ending, just the dialog in section or the visual scenes you unlock.  There is serveral pictures that are unlocked only through selecting certain choices. Take a look at the guides for this VN. Good for 4 or 5 hours of reading, 3 to 4 runs through.  Warning: NSFW. Could give men a boner.  

Might be worth the full price, but better to get this on sale or with the Sakura Bundle.

For more info.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055369386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1476908609}
review:
This is the story about a pair of shiny breasts and their adventures with other shiny breasts and sometimes there are cameos by shiny thighs. 

What can I say? I was bored and heard it had comedic value if nothing else. Unfortunately, it seems to be a sense of humour I don't share. Personally, I have nothing against nudity or fanservice for that matter, but in this case it sort of falls into a category of its own where there is so much of it that there's nothing exciting about it. I haven't got the uncensored patch, but I honestly don't see how it could add anything of value.

Worst of all though is probably the characters, who are so flat and forgettable that I can't be bothered to care when they're supposed to have an emotional scene that leads to character development. They're not characters with big breasts as much as they're big breasts with people attached to them. The only good thing I can say about this game is that the artist did a good job with the colours and I liked the soundtrack.

Is this a good game or a bad game? I don't know. It doesn't satisfy any of my preferences, so in that regard it's an unfulfilling experience to me. It would probably be a good idea to check out other reviews too, positive as well as negative before making a decision. A lot of people obviously don't share my issues with the game, and so I imagine they're satisfied with their purchase. This is more of warning for people who suspect they might be bothered by the same things that bothered me.

Simply put, if you're not bothered by skimpy impractical outfits or nudity, but you feel that too much of it has the opposite effect on you than what the artist intended and if you're willing to forgive a predictable story on the condition that the humour is good, then I'd advise you to stay away from this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166807011', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1511695409}
review:
This is the second game I have played by this developer.  I played Sakura Swim Club first.

Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 is a visual created in Ren'Py.  Compared to Swim Club it has a much better story, more characters, better graphics, and better sound.  The choices also change what scenes you get, so they sort of matter.  It also has a hentai patch.  Get this one before Swim Club because it's a hundred times better.

The story in not completed, this is chapter 1.  There is no indictation if Chapter 2 even be released or how many chapters they intend to make.  I recommend this product 100%, but keep in mind that the story may never get resolved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007589948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1470177172}
review:
Probably the best one out of the Sakura series I have played so far, right behind Sakura spirit. (havent tried sakura dungeon yet)
It has decent story which ends halfway so you are looking forward to a sequel, beautiful girls in skimpy clothing and also some 18+ moments if you apply the patch for it. Choices are there basically only for the sake of unlocking different scenes which doesnt have any real impact on how the story will play out but thats fine.
I can definitely recommend this and it is worth the money even when not on sale though if you can get it during one then it is a nobrainer.

I will give it 9/10. If they would improve the animation or more like added some actual animation in there I might even give it perfect score but sadly nothing is really perfect :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1472378010}
review:
Longest and filled with fan service VN compare to all the rest of the Sakura games on Steam.

It's even got a uncensor patch which remove a lot of the picture/storyline filter to show more research material then the orginal game.

In fact if you play the uncensored version there are actually 1 on 1 sex scene between girls in a couple of the occasion. Which is very rare on steam since it doesn't endorse sexual explict content.

Graphics and music are both very well done in style of all other sakura games. The plot is simple but you can go 2 different route depend on your story choices. (which lead to different CG)

8/10 for a fun, interesting, plot driven, research material filled Sakura game.

review:

I can recommend this right now, but that will change if it doesn't have a much stronger follow up.

If all you care about is the hentai, then go to a hentai site, lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012875077', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1464034374}
review:
We all know that the Sakura series are nothing but breasts and awkward sexual situations, mostly there's not much of a story in the games. It's normally just a game with nice art, but I actually found Sakura Fantasy very enjoyable since it's probably the Sakura game with the best story.

Sakura Fantasy is the story of a novice who wants to become a knight, but her life suddenly changes when she meets the Empress and witnesses a burning star falling from the heavens. Together with her friend and her superior, she accepts the mission to find the burning star and take it to the Empress, hoping that this adventure will also help her discover something about her past.

As I mentioned, the story is rather interesting and enjoyable in Sakura Fantasy. The art is beautiful and the characters are quite funny, but I wouldn't recommend buying it at full price unless you're really interested in a cheap 18+ game with quite decent sex scenes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078533804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1467574333}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037101281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1463532341}
review: I want to give this a neutral recomendation. Don't get me wrong, for a visual novel that is built off of basically game porn, it has a shockingly good story, beautiful art, very nice music, and (of course) beautiful women (And an uncensored version that includes sex scenes and full nudity). However, the problem is that the story is unfinished and there seems to be no indication that they are even working on chapter 2. It annoys me that they are not completing the story, especially since the story was good enough to make me forget about cleavage (Sometimes). For those that don't care about the story, go ahead and buy it. For those that do care, Decide whether it is worth reading an unfinished story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162703817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1468972721}
review:
The story concept is interesting.

But there's a difference between a concept, and the actual product. While I did like the writing style, there was something about the dialogue and descriptions, that had my mind feeling bored. Kind of a vague reason, I know.

Story involves novices in training, where everyone in the world has special powers, or 'Gifts', as the game puts it. Protagonist can make her spirit leave her body, and the reason they're all training in the first place, is because of the beasts that lives beyond their town walls, in a place called 'The Mire'. That part reminds me of Attack on Titans, though the monsters that appear in the story really aren't that huge. Surprisingly, the choices in the game are pretty frequent.

Usually visual novels just give a bare minimum of sorts, and it's been much too long since I've played Sakura Angels, one of the Sakura series that I do like, to really judge whether or not it's normal for the Sakura games. Still, with Chapter 2 apparently coming on the way, and this being a Sakura game, I'll be supporting it either way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011418292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1467844410}
review:
It's ok.  A bit short but the choices do at least make reasonable differences to the overall story.
Doesn't quite have the same charms as some of the other stories since it's lacking the male-female scenarios.
Angels and Swimclub had that in spades which made those all the more funny, and rather cringy too! :)
In conclusion, this one is alright, but if you're new to these sort of things, try Sakura Angels, spirit, or something like nekopara instead first.  Oh yeah, and buy them in the sale.  Â£7 full price for 2 hours of storytime isn't a particularly good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117484140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1540430096}
review:
This visual novel obviously shows that a lot of time and effort has gone into creating the high quality artwork and interesting storyline. Whats more, I personally love the style of the characters in this VN, quite more than some other ones. My only disappointments are:
- the limited amount of choices you get to make
- [spoiler]lack of sex scenes/nudity/juices[/spoiler]
- the general shortness of the story. I honestly couldn't get enough of this VN (especially with that exciting patch).

Regardless, I highly recommend Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 to anyone who enjoys the Sakura series or even enjoys visual novels in general. If you were to get this visual novel I strongly recommend you install the available patch to go with it, as it adds more 'content'.

I honestly cannot wait for Chapter 2, the end of the story left me hanging so much I cannot handle it!!!

review:
An interesting, though somewhat cliche' story.  I'll buy Chapter 2 when (if?) it comes out.

I see some complaints about the price.  Well, try finding a manga at this price...and a lot manga can be read in an hour or so. And most are not in color.

Spending 8.99 USD for a few hours of reading material is not overpriced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053788131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1464791021}
review:
[h1]OVERVIEW[/h1]
Sakura Fantasy (chapter 1) is an almost all-female fantasy anime visual novel with erotic scenes. Being on Steam the scenes are very tame, but there is an adults-only patch available for free download if you're so inclined.

The protagonist is Raelin, a young female warrior-in-training with a special ability, farsight, that enables her to concentrate and observe events from a distance, unseen. 

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The scenes are nicely drawn, but often repeated, making the story seem even slower. The characters are beautiful, as you'd expect from Winged Cloud, but again, expressions and poses are often repeated, and the creative use of animation and movement seen in Sakura Angels is not quite as good here.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
Music is acceptable, and sound effects few and far between. The game is almost entirely voiced in Japanese, though, which is great. I don't speak Japanese well enough to know if the voices are sticking to the dialogue, but they sound professional and akin to many an anime that I've seen in quality.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Sakura Fantasy plays like any other visual novel: you read the story in a window at the bottom while looking at context-specific backgrounds and characters, sometimes complete with animations, on the rest of the screen. You make choices at certain points in the story for Raelin, the main character, and otherwise you watch and read. There's nothing new to the genre in Sakura Fantasy.

The story itself is quite slow and long winded. Raelin Raelin's friend, Gwynn, and teacher, Keira, are the most common characters you'll encounter, and they accompany her when the Empress sends Raelin on a quest into the wilderness.

Sakura Fantasy is an adult entry in Winged Cloud's lineup, however, and the story is interspersed with a number of graphical scenes of a sensual, if not sexual, nature, particularly when Raelin makes creative use of her special ability. I found most of these scenes fairly gratuituous, as if the plot took a quick sideline just as an excuse for another bathing scene, and they could have done with a bit more subtlety. But the art is nice.

[h1]PROS AND CONS[/h1]

Pros:
+ Nice art featuring a host of attractive anime girls
+ Adult patch available, but not forced on you if you're not into that sort of thing
+ Trading cards

Cons:
- The story is fairly bland and takes a long time to actually get anywhere, and then it stops (end of chapter 1)
- Some poor writing and a number of grammatical errors
- No achievements, which would have been a great addition

[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]
Sakura Fantasy (Chapter 1) is not as fun so interesting a story as some other visual novels on Steam, such as Winged Cloud's Sakura Angels.

I'm a fan of anime and enjoy visual novels, but there are better ones out there. I hope Winged Cloud improve the story for the next chapter. I still recommend Sakura Fantasy (Chapter 1) if you like anime visual novels, particularly if you enjoy a bit of gratuitious anime nudity and don't mind installing a patch.

[h1]6/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198107213138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1462330620}
review:
Extremely short. It took just minutes longer than two hours to finish, with credits. 

The artwork is pretty, but very basic. The CGs are cute, but it definite is one of those VNs where they created the CGs first and then made up a story to try to connect it all together. If you came here for the story, you'll probably be disappointed. If you came here for the nudity, you'll probably still be disappointed. 

Buy this if you used to like reading "Choose Your Own Adventure!" books but found them too difficult to make sense of, and thought "Wouldn't it be great if someone could choose my adventure for me, and make it into a picutre book?!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198256990561', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1462240616}
review:
Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 is another part of the Sakura Series developed by winged cloud. It is also by far my favourite Sakura Series game,
The game have an interesting story, plenty of good cgs, and the characters are voiced which is a great addition to the reading enjoyment.
It featured lots of choices, so you can get juicy yuri content depending on which heroines you are after or just replay them over to see all of them.

11/10 would recommend the game to my friends. Waiting for Chapter 2!!! Please Winged Cloud!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037114623', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1496555032}
review:
Explore a kingdom, makes somewhat pointless decisions, ship yuri, and play as a psyker with the powers of prescience which, dispite it's portantial use for plot development, instead get used to spy on your friends while they masterbate. 

It's a VN by Winged Cloud (not sure why clouds need wings, I mean, they're collections of warer molicules in vapor form), a short one at that (roughly 6 hours long). For most that's explanation enough. However this one sets itself apart because; A. You're character isn't a faceless person, and actually has a character model, and B. There isn't a complete story enclosed (sorry for most of you who were here for the plot). 

Not sure whether or not there will be a chapter 2, and all things considered it's a bit short for $10, but if it's your thing, I guess ir's worth a look. 

Now if you'll excuse me, I need a shower...

author: {'steamid': '76561198038632029', 'num_games_owned': 1323, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1527538167}
review:
Sakura Fantasy is yet another visual novel from studio Winged Cloud, who are "notorious" for releasing visual novels with strong ecchi content in them.

WISE WORDS:
While I cannot say that I played a huge number of visual novels (yet as hardcore anime fan definitely much more as your average Steam gamer), Sakura Fantasy has one fundamental difference from the most harem visual novels, which is that you - the protagonist - is just such a sexy and cute girl, as your potentional candidates for romance.
Yes, you play as Raelin, a trainee swordswoman (a novice knight respectively) coming from the countryside, who has a slightly perverted mind, which includes peeking on others while they are nude and getting naked herself, without any feeling of shame. Her gift (basically special powers what each girl has and it varies by person) is "farseeing" which allows her soul to temporarily leave her body and look arround. Interesting trivia about Raelin is, that she has a yaeba - a single fang-like teeth visible by opened mouth, which in anime usually characterizes youthful, slightly prankster-ish, overly optimistic female characters. To give a proof about this, is that she uses often her gift to peek on the other girls while they are bathing or changing. At least that it has a limited uses per day...
Being a character which is at no means worth less on the imagined sexiness scale as the other important female characters, gives a completly different feeling as you chop trough the game compared your classic male VS many girls typical harem visual novel, especially if the main guy is kicked arround by the girls like some soccerball.
Except this, another positive thing what made the game enjoyable, that all main characters are very emphatic. Your best friend, the blonde blue-eyed noble Gwynne cares about you a lot. Your instructor, the serious tan-skinned Keira who is very strict on training, cares about you. Empress Ardena, who otherwise shows a cold aura to the outside world - cares about you. (despite that you don't even recognize her at your first guard duty in the palace) Basically everybody who means something in the game cares about you a lot. Isn't friendship between girls fantastic? It makes me even think that the target audience for this game are actually girls.

STORY:
This game is entirely linear with no standalone routes for the different characters. The offered choices have minimal impact onto the game itself - usually only about with which girl you want spend your free time, have a kissing contest or a classic lesbian sex intercourse. Since it lacks particular routes, you can freely switch between the girls and nobody will accuse you of cheating.
Regarding the depth of the story - it's a working fantasy story with a few ocassional jokes and with no real surprises. A star has fallen from the sky and the empress needs a volenteer group to check it out in the cursed swamps, where nobody has balls to set foot in. Good thing that we are all girls, so nobody has even balls by default... Although the depth of the story is very often shallowed by generic ecchi scenes like slimes eating down the heroines armor or tentacles groping their "finer parts".
Surprisingly there are even fights and we get a slight cliffhanger on the end - but it's like see you in chapter 2, which also tells that the game is short, a way too short. Let's hope that the new chapter fixes this, though I'm not too much fan of this game chaptering - considering the game lenght, the two chapters should be one game.

ART:
I already gave a few hints that the game has a lot of eyecandy. This isn't only true for the perverted scenes, but generally the girls, the backgrounds, the scene CG's look fantasic. The girls are sexy yet cute, adult yet young, strong yet femine, which not many anime artist can do properly. The responsible artist for this is Waneca. His designs reminds me a lot the art of the famous Hitoshi Oshiki.
Funnily - while noname characters aren't really important - basically no male characters here are important in any way, art-wise they are at least one league bellow the females. The unnamed female trainee looks somehow comparable to Raelin and co, but males just don't. Even your fellow guardsman in palace (to me the only guy who had some good lines) stays the whole time entirely covered in armor. Don't think I'm some feminist or what, but I didn't really minded this one. Girl power!

AUDIO:
The music goes well with the game. It felt good when I was playing, but I will not put a track from it to my phone as a ringtone.
As of the latest patch, complete voice acting of the main heroines has been released. Not exactly how I imagined their voices, but is clearly professionally done and blends in perfectly with the atmosphere and the presumed age of the characters. Highfives for Cloud Wing to release this for entirely as free and not asking cash for it "part of DLC" as some other studios do.

THE AWAITED BAD:
Of course this game at no means cannot be compared to professional visual novels. The only thing where it really can stand it's ground it's the professional art design, but everything else is just mediocre. The shortcomings of this game are basically included in the word itself - it's a way too short and has no "comings" meaning that the game lacks choices making a noticable difference to the story.

CONCLUSION:
So is the game worth picking up or not? I would say definitely yes, if you catch it on a good sale. If I forget about the "oh wow nude girls let's get it" or the "too linear, too short, not worth" generic opinions this game truly shines by the great cast of characters who grow to your heart. After finishing the game, I felt like I'm Raelin and cannot wait when I can meet up with the others (maybe for some girly fun). Each on his/her own, but for me this can completly change my standpoint to any game, especially when the theme is anime.

THE UNMENTIONABLES:
The game has a uncensored patch which changes some CGs and makes bodyparts - what only girls have, entirely visible. If somebody feels that he wants try the game from the hentai view, should go for it, they look really pretty.

Cannot wait for the second chapter. Damn, they sure take their time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223042200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1470065828}
review:
Loved it and a good read.

Music: 8/10
Visual / Artwork: 9/10

Pros:
1. An interesting read about a fantasy world
2. mostly yuri as the Main Character (female) intereacts with other female characters
3. Loads of fan-service
4. R18 contents (if patched.)
5. Intriguing plot

50/50
1. Choices sometimes counter other choices
2. Character development is very straightforward

Cons:
1. Feels very briefed. story has its foundation but feels a little too briefed

author: {'steamid': '76561198100367372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1454818788}
review:
As a diligent puruser of anime babes... I give this game two cheeto-dust encrusted thumbs up. Of all the Sakura series games I've played, this is easily the best. The story actually has some substance (Nothing incredible, but what are you expecting?) and the characters are pretty likeable and as varied as you could hope for. (Also, as opposed to the first Sakura Spirit, you actually have some choices to make in game.)


Go ahead and check it out! For the price, it's a cute little VN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052792745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1457211708}
review:
Overall this is the best Sakura Game in my opinion. 
It's story is really good and gives you free space to let your mind wander off and actually "be in the game". 

The story plot, the CG's, the music and the sczenery is really well put together and gave at least me a really enjoyable time of playing. 

I would really recommend this game since I don't see any downsides. ( Of course this is my personal opinion )

author: {'steamid': '76561198147598935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1518775310}
review:
This game has lots of "plot", but it also has a very well-crafted storyline lingering behind it.  I quickly found this game to be very captivating.  My only complaint is that it just isn't long enough in my opinion.  The game left me wanting more.

This is definitely one of my favorite visual novels, and is worth picking up.
I can't wait for Chapter 2!

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

- Lots of "plot".
- A well crafted storyline.
- An amazing soundtrack.
- Lots and lots of save files.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

- NOT LONG ENOUGH!

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025913007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1451875364}
review:
This is the biggest and best Sakura game of the franchise.  The writing is good, the story and world are interesting, and all of the characters are cool.  And just like with Sakura Swim Club, there is a patch for uncensoring the nudity should you want it.  And while some of the sexual elements in this game are a little weird, there is nothing out and out objectionable.

Sadly, I've heard that it might not get a sequel, which would mean that the story will remain unfinished.  It's still cool though and I hope the developer revisits it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075274628', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1482267507}
review:
One of the better visual novels in the Sakura series. This game offers meaningful choices that decide what kind of nudes you get. Some of the more advanced choices decide who you have intense lesbian sex with. And it's some [i]real nice[/i] lesbian sex. 

Everything that's good about this game:
[*] Women are very hot
[*] Story (if you actually read these novels) is pretty good
[*] Choices that make very miniscule differences in the very challenging gameplay
[*] As stated by others, good "workout" material [/list]

Some downsides:
[*] You're going to need to buy [b]A LOT[/b] more tissues
[*] You're parents will be very disappointed 
[*] You will lose 80% of your friends[/list]

10/10 for women      7.5/10 for story

author: {'steamid': '76561198006807384', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1450687362}
review:
I don't like paying anything for games that are that short in storyline and have little to no consequence or benefits to decisions that you make.

Doesn't show nudity, so don't get your hopes up.  Google the added content if you want that.  I prefer without it anyway as those nudity shots are nothing that I couldn't have put in myself (via imagination or patching) (same artwork, just added in nipples kind of thing).

Replay-ability is out the window.  I have no intention of ever playing this again.  Story wasn't that good to make me remember much of it a few weeks later.

Seems like it takes just long enough to complete to avoid it being returned according to Steam's return policy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047675051', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1477101313}
review:
Multiple Yuri scenes... 10/10 would lose all of my friends again. 

Okay let's do an actual review in a way :P. This is by far one of my favorite games in the Sakura series along with Sakura Swim Club. A ton of choices compared to the previous games, nice characters, amazing CG's, and an interesting story. Also has a full Japanese voice over now which means the dev's didn't abandon this series and may have Sakura Fantasy Chapter 2 releasing soon!  I already played through the game 3 times, but now with the voice over time to run through it again. I would definitely recommend buying this game even if you get it for the full $9.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091718025', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1435790992}
review:
Sakura Fantasy has one of the most in-depth stories that I have seen in the Sakura games so far. The story is interesting and the characters actually matter in it. Also, the conflicts keep you on the edge of your seat as the main characters get themselves into trouble that has no clear outcome. The chapter ends on a cliffhanger and makes you end up wanting more.

Also, it is the first game to include a female protagonist. And they're lesbian. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198159436313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1451483923}
review: Aside from the obvious nude pictures, the game has a great story that is going somewhere. Unfortunatly, the ending to chapter 1 was  a little bit of a surprise becuase I was reading for a bout 3 hours and the chapter ended. Other than that, this is a very good visual novel, but for the price that I paid for it, I would have expected it to be a little longer of a first chapter. None the less, I think that this is a great visual novel for it's ablility to let you make your own descisions and to have a role in the story. I can't wait for chapter 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995985473', 'num_games_owned': 2646, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1449520272}
review: For a cheesecake OEL visual novel, [i]Sakura Fantasy[/i] is a surprisingly competent read. Strongest in the art department, but doesn't slouch on music or storytelling, either, minor grammatical errors or no; relatively perfect were it not for the false sense of free choice.

review:
HAHAHAHA oh my god.
I guess this is another case of a game being so full of anime stereotypes and predictable cheese that it's actually enjoyable. I for one enjoy cheese when it's served with abnormally large boobs, basically-tentacle fetish scenes and icky chocolate baths.
Ah, Sakura games. You laugh but you're probably going to end up playing their other games anyways. Can never go wrong with yuri.

69/10 will play chapter 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089477451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1617849710}
review:
I have only one issue with this game, but I will save that for later.

To begin with, my only trekk into Sakura territory was Sakura Beach and Sakura Swim Club. Swim Club has a compressed story but remains satisfying even after I've read through it several times, regardless of the sex scenes. While it was disappointing at first (and my review of the first one still stands) Sakura Beach featured colorful personality to its characters, making it much easier to get engaged once I understood how the characters interacted with one another. 

This though.....this should be a triple-A title. 

The abundance of choices does nothing to water down the detail - even something as simple as a knight on guard duty affects not only your interpretation of the storyline, but has a subtle effect on watching the main heroine's development. I found that I was reminded of two games I deeply enjoy - inFAMOUS, known for tying good and evil into a delicate decision-based karma system, and the Tales series, which once put emphasis on choices that determined who stood by you the most when you were at your worst. 

The rich detail, the improved music, even the choice to go to a visible female lead instead of a background male one - everything about Sakura Fantasy takes the best of RPGs, eroges, and VNs and puts it together in one seamless chapter. I will DEFINITELY purchase the others when they are released!

Oh, and my complaint? Only that this isn't a Tales game itself. I could come to love playing as Gwynne or the Empress....

author: {'steamid': '76561198046502352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1457277197}
review:
Um dann nun auch (endlich) alle Sakura Titel von meiner To-Do Liste durch zu haben, habe ich mich auch noch an Sakura Fantasy heran gewagt. Theoretisch wÃ¼rde zur VollstÃ¤ndigkeit noch Sakura Beach fehlen, davon habe ich allerdings nie einen Key bekommen und kaufen werde ich es mir sicherlich nicht. Um schon einmal etwas vorweg zu nehmen, kann man hier dann wirklich mal sagen: Das Beste kommt zum Schluss. Auch wenn es nicht schwer war, die anderen Teile zu Ã¼berbietenâ€¦

    [quote]Titel: Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1
    Entwickler: Winged Cloud
    Genre: Fantasy, Ecchi
    LÃ¤nge: ~2h
    Premiere: 29. Mai 2015

    Story:
    The new visual novel from the makers of Sakura Spirit and Sakura Angels.

    Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 is an exciting visual novel fantasy adventure where you decide the development of the story by the choices you make.

    It is the tale of an aspiring female protagonist who wishes to aim to become a knight.[/quote]

[h1]Handlung:[/h1]

Winged Cloud wagt sich hier mal an eine lÃ¤ngere Geschichte heran. Chapter 1 dauert allerdings trotzdem mal wieder nicht lÃ¤nger als 2h zu lesen. Aber dadurch, dass die Handlung auf mehrere Teile aufgesplittet wird, gibt es mal ein halbwegs vernÃ¼nftiges Pacing und es wird nicht einfach von einer Ecchi Szene zur nÃ¤chsten geeilt. Ob die Handlung nun sonderlich berauschend ist, lasse ich mal dahin gestellt.

Die Protagonistin mÃ¶chte gerne Ritterin werdenâ€¦.. Landet allerdings nur als Wache im Schloss. Hier trifft sie dann auf die Empress und knÃ¼pft Kontakte zur ihr. Als dann ein Stern vom Himmel fÃ¤llt, melden sie und ihre Freundin, sowie Chefin sich freiwillig um den besagten Stern fÃ¼r die Empress zu holen.

Der Storyansatz klingt soweit erst einmal nicht schlecht, bei der Umsetzung hapert es aber immer noch. Die Novel braucht viel zu lange, bis endlich mal irgendwas passiert, was nicht zu einer neuen Ecchi Szene fÃ¼hrt. Was sehr stÃ¶rend dieses Mal ist, sind die ganzen Entscheidungen. GefÃ¼hlt (und teilweise auch tatsÃ¤chlich) muss man alle 10 Zeilen Dialog eine Entscheidung treffen, die in 90% der FÃ¤lle keinerlei Auswirkung haben. Eine Zeile Text Ã¤ndert sich nach manchen Entscheidungen und das warâ€™s dann auch. Das ist doch wirklich ein schlechter Witz. Es stÃ¶rt ungemein den Lesefluss stÃ¤ndig dann auf etwas klicken zu mÃ¼ssen, was 0 Einfluss hat. Letztendlich ist hier dann auch wieder das Problem, dass Teile der Story durch Plot ersetzt wurden.

[h1]Illustrationen:[/h1]

Bei der Bewertung der Illustrationen, kann ich mich eigentlich nur das wiederholen, was bereits beim letzten Sakura * Review gesagt wurde: Alles ordentlich und sauber, aber es fehlt die Liebe zum Detail. Die CGs sind gewohnt fokussiert auf die Oberweite und die Charakterdarstellungen haben die Ã¼blichen paar Posen mit variierenden GesichtsausdrÃ¼cken. Selbst bei dem Ecchi Anteil hat man mittlerweile das GefÃ¼hl, als wenn es sich hier schon aus den anderen Sakura Novels wiederholt.

[h1]Charaktere:[/h1]

Bei den Charakteren gibt es eine positive Ãœberraschung zu verzeichnen. Anstatt dem Waschlappenprotagonisten wie sonst, gibt es dieses mal einen komplett weiblichen Cast und die Protagonistin jammert auch nicht nur durch die Gegend. Leider ist sie aber nicht die beste Charakterein vom Cast, sondern vor allem die Empress ist es, die es irgendwie interessant gemacht hat. Sie scheint die einzige zu sein, die wirklich ein bisschen PersÃ¶nlichkeit verpasst bekommen hat. Alle anderen Charaktere sind wieder eher recht emotionslos und weisen nicht wirklich Tiefgang auf.

[h1]Sound:[/h1]

Beim Sound weiÃŸ ich wirklich nicht mehr was ich schreiben soll. Daher machen wir das ganz einfach:
â˜‘ generisch
â˜‘ schnell wieder vergessen
â˜ begeisternd

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]

Well. Alles in allem ist es einfach nur ein weiteres Sakura Game. Mittlerweile sollte hinreichend bekannt sein, was man bei diesen Noveln erwarten kann. In dem Sinne tut sich Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 nun auch nicht positiver hervor, als die anderen Vertreter, ist sogar was die Entscheidungen angeht schlechter. Allerdings hat man sich dieses mal ein bisschen mehr Zeit fÃ¼r die Handlung genommen, was ganz angenehm ist. Auch die Charaktere haben mir hier ein bisschen besser gefallen. Die Protagonistin ist schon einmal eine positive Steigerung und auch bei den anderen Charakteren wurde anscheinend ein bisschen mehr Arbeit herein gesteckt. Es gibt hier zwar kein Fluffy Tail, trotzdem ist es bisher doch von den Sakura Games das [strike]beste[/strike] am wenigsten schlechte.

[h1]5/10[/h1]

review:
O Melhor jogo da sÃ©rie Sakura atÃ© agora, levando em conta que sÃ³ joguei o Spirit e o Angels antes desse

MAIS PEITOS, MAIS HISTÃ“RIA, MAIS PEITOS E UM PATCH +18 *---*
JÃ DISSE QUE TEM PEITOS?

Trilha sonora fantastica, cenarios diversos e vÃ¡rias escolhas pra fazer, vale a pena sim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104214038', 'num_games_owned': 2125, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1649154370}
review:
This Sakura game has the best story out of all the Sakura games I've played so far. Hands down. I think the fact that this is the first game in a longer series made the story much better. The first half of this game is all about introducing us to the characters, getting to known them and their backstories a bit, and just getting a general feel for the setting. The second half is where things get actiony and they tease ever so slightly at what is to come in later installments. The writing in this is so much better than previous games it's astounding. This might be my favorite Sakura game so far, either this or Swim Club cause that one is super great too. The art is perfect as always, Wanaca never disappoints. I'm excited for Chapter 2 and hope the wait for it won't be too long.

I also really liked that the MC is female for a change. It gives the game a much different feel than the other Sakura games. The MC also has a fun little power that lets her basically project her mind and become the best peeping tom ever. Hilarity follows.

Update: Winged Cloud just released an uncensored patch like the one for Swim Club.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131887849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1460889789}
review:
I will say this upfront. I am not very well-versed when it comes to visual novels. Not particularly a fan of them, either.  Largely because I generally don't consider them to be games. Look at Skyrim, Devil May Cry, or Metal Gear Solid. All of those are games. Because you take active role in what happens in those games. Visual novels, on the other hand, are products where you generally read a wall of text with characters on screen making facial expressions to match their emotions. I prefer my games where I do something other than just sit and read. If I wanted to read, I would read a book. But that's a different topic. Right now, I am going to review Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1.

Sakura Fantasy is a game that draws you in with the promise of anime girls in various states of undress and sexuality. And for the first few hours, it seems to be just that. Our protagonist heroine, Raelin, is a knight-to-be, born with the ability of far-seeing that allows her to seeing into places that is not in her line of sight hence the name. Which everyone assumes she uses to spy on other people in their private moments. And despite her denial when asked directly, she actually does. 

But is it truly a boob/yuri-fest and nothing more? It is true that those exist. But it's not all that this novel is about. It delivers a compelling story with an interesting setting. If you can look past the nudity, and are able to ignore that "itchy" feeling you get inbetween your legs.

I don't like being that person but... If you are a fan of anime, like anime girls and/or possess an artistic appreciation for the female body, there is a good chance you will like this game. If you don't like the female physique being treated as a mere object, dislike anime or nudity in any form of media, it's more than likely that you will hate this "game". This is a "game" targeted for open-minded individuals who have no qualms about nudity in their stories/games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084237526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1445477485}
review:
While this is the first VN i have read on steam, it is not the first one i have read; so i know what does and doesn't make a good VN. I am happy to say, this one ticks all the right boxes for a VN. 

With an interesting background and an interesting cast of characters, this fantasy story did pull me in with it's music and background arts. while some people might complain about the partial nudity in some of the arts, i find them kinda entertaining to view, since most NV doesn't push those limits ;3

The story as a whole is about 2-3 hours in length, depending on how fast you read, and with multiple different pathways (choices) adds alot of replayability (or should it be Re-Readability?) to the overall story. while it does to me kinda finish abrupty the story, it does leave alot of interesting plots to continue in the future with chapter 2 (as well as more after that), and comparing this as Chapter 1, to other NVs, it is quite long. 

overall this is a very good NV, with alot of potental, we will just have to see in chapter 2 ;3

8.6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198126468970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1505017980}
review:
Fun game, At first I thought the choices made no difference but as I was play it deeply into the story, I did notice some slight changes. But the most impactful change with your choices is 2 CG arts within the game you can only get by chosing wisely.

The story focuses on a female knight in training named Raelin, There are like 4 girls you can romance in the game ( actually 5 if you count r@pe ).
Raelin has a rare gift known as farseeing, giving her the ability to spy on someone's most private moments without them knowing it. but because of this rare gift, She not well trusted among her comrades. I would say more but this is a game where you should expierience the story instead of me telling you.

This game will take you about 4 to 5 hours to complete, but if you are trying to get all CG Arts ( which you should ) It'll take about an extra 2 hours to 100% everything!

This is a fun game ( well visual novel ) filled with tons of sexy fan service and an interesting story to back it up. This is the first chapter of the Sakura Fantasy series so there's bound to be more chapters coming soon.

If you love Anime, a good story, beautiful art, fan service & hentai ( There are hentai moments in this game but worry not, Nothing besides cleverly censored naked bodies and bondage like moments ) You'll thoroughly enjoy this game.

Keep in mind that this game ISN'T for kids! Overall, This is a fun and enjoyable little gem that's worth a purchase!

Also this game is 100% Yuri! ^-^

author: {'steamid': '76561198040319157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1433881594}
review:
Mmm... Chocolate...
Oh, sorry, I got a bit distracted there... I'm hungry! Don't judge me!
But in all seriousness... This first chapter of the Fantasy-series proves that the team behind it can actually make a decent, somewhat interesting story that doesn't rely entirely on fanservice to keep you going. Don't get me wrong, there's still plenty of it to go around, including a whole lot of chocolate...
Well, there are people who dream about literally swimming in cash, so chocolate isn't so far off if you think about it...
What makes this story different from the other Sakura novels currently released, you may ask? A female avatar. That's right, you play a girl in this one! And it doesn't take long for you to realise it either... I must say, putting on underwear isn't that time-consuming...
But yeah, you play a woman in a regiment seemingly composed entirely of other women, including a rock-hard drill instructor. (10 points if you get that joke once you start reading.) And of course, you end up on an adventure in a desolate swampland... What is this? I thought this was supposed to be a light-hearted erotica. Oh wait, perverted slimes... never mind.
But once again, there's no actual nudity in this game. There are scenes which imply nudity, and some slightly exposing pictures to keep you running. But that's as far as Steam will allow it to go... Oh, and some girls kissing. That works too.
But I'm going to stop rambling on now and simply get to the point: A decent story to give some foundation to the more or less erotic pictures you'll come across over the... say, 30 minutes or so it'll take to read through this thing once. But don't feel ashamed if your total time clocks higher than that: There are plenty of routes to take for more (or less) fanservice! Just don't expect any of your choices to have much of an impact on the story... It is a novel, not a "choose-your-own-adventure" game.
Anyway, with all that said, I'm going to go find something to eat... I wonder if there's any chocolate in the fridge...

author: {'steamid': '76561198032143607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1435917260}
review:
Sakura Fantasy in Chapter 1 has done a great work so far. It deserves a 4.2/5 for good reasons. There are more choices than previous games, there is a good story going here and the choices seem more relevant. Looking forward to more. The CG as usual great. They keep this up, a 5 might be closer than they think. The idea of the story and setting is quite nice and the characters grow more in but as the story goes it all depends. I look forward to chapter 2.  I recommend it. It has definitely taken steps up from previous games how it goes from here we'll see.
As far as this goes, hope more characters join in and the story continues to grow as well unlike previous ones.
Also would like to see if they do have an end route after transfer of saves, that helps a lot more crossing fun.
If they ever cross characters from previous games though and add them to route and cg, that'd be interesting.
However you got to play it yourself to understand. This game got me aware of the setting more so it's a good start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079352480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1435440145}
review:
Unfortunately, I've played all the Sakura games thus far, and while this one is the best one out of the three, it still fails to meet my expectations for a proper visual novel game.

The writing is a lot better, focusing more on dialogue and development of the story and characters, but even then, what they've done isn't great by any standard. The characters don't really stand out, and what little of their personalities we see aren't really touched on. The world isn't built up enough, simply going to the old 'World is in turmoil, and we live secluded in a city' plot, that, while it can be an interesting way to set up your story, it can fail hard when not given more depth. If the writer had taken more time to flesh out the chapter, then maybe it could've pulled it out of the blandness that it ended up becoming.

The art is better than before, giving characters more poses and backgrounds more of an immersive feel, but, overall, it's not really something we haven't seen done better by other developers with less of an art budget. Not to mention the CGs tend to leave something to be desired (and not just nudity, haha). They just seem a bit lackluster for what an artist can really do. They're the images that aren't bound by the need to be compatible with multiple poses and animation, so they can throw a lot more detail in, but they just go for the same amount that we can see in the character sprites, which is disappointing.

The sound/music isn't anything that we haven't heard before in the previous games, and it's not great, but not bad, either.

And do NOT get me started on visual novels that lack complex decision trees. THAT'S where the fun in playing them lies, because you feel the weight of your decisions firsthand, thus making you think about what you decide what to do next, rather than just 'pick your scene/heroine' gameplay, which can be interesting, if the writing and art can make up for it, but referring back to my previous statements, they don't.

Whenever I play one of the Sakura games, I always feel like I'm reading an anime, or rather that Winged Cloud really wants their visual novel to be an anime rather than a visual novel. Others can do it quite well (e.g. Steins;Gate), but if Sakura Fantasy were to become one by some extreme stroke of luck, it would be half-assed, even then.

The developers of the Sakura series need to seriously get their heads out of their asses, and learn from their mistakes, rather than producing more bland wastes of time that just put visual novel games in even more of a bad light than they already are.

All I'm glad for is that Steam refunds are possible, because this game isn't worth the money I spent to play it, and unless Winged Cloud manages to make something worth my time, I'll never purchase their games again, and I hope that no one else does either, because no person deserves to have to play through a game as boring as this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065455947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1434636642}
review:
This is Italian review. Sorry, I don't think I have the ability to write a english review.

-

Per quanto competente come la trama puÃ² essere, e attraente come molti troveranno questa Visual Novel, Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 Ã¨ estremamente breve. Per essere piÃ¹ precisi e pignoli, ho finito la storia principale in 76 minuti. Questo indica che per chi ha una lettura molto fluida e una conoscenza della lingua Inglese migliore della mia, potrebbe finirlo in meno di un'ora. 
Ci sono diversi eventi che si possono verificare, ma alla fine il risultato Ã¨ sempre lo stesso, qualsiasi scelta voi fate. 
Come si fa a vedere scene diverse? 
Semplice, rigiocatela piÃ¹ volte. La cosa piÃ¹ bella, al di fuori della storia principale leggermente brebe, Ã¨ che in questo capitolo di Sakura, ci sono un sacco di scelte da fare. 
Questo Ã¨ un grande passo dai titoli precedenti, anche se a dire la veritÃ , non sembra ancora che importi piÃ¹ di tanto, dato che la vera storia duri a malapena un film. 
Gli sviluppatori della serie Sakura stanno finalmente creando giochi che forniscono ampie quantitÃ  di fanservice e un'interessante trama tutto sommato. Il rilascio di Sakura Fantasy chapter 1 puo' essere considerato come uno slancio della serie, costando la stessa cifra dei titoli precedenti, ed offrendo molto meno dal punto di vista della longevitÃ . 
Se il capitolo 2 non riuscirÃ  ad aumentare quest'ultima caratteristica, per concludersi, la storia, potrebbe richierdere piÃ¹ capitoli del dovuto, anche se il successo ottenuto fino ad ora potrebbe andare in fumo.

PRO
- I disegni, come sempre, sono eccezionali.
- Molte scelte.


CONTRO
- LongevitÃ  della storia.
- Scelte che incidono poco sulla trama.


Voto: 7/10

Link alla recensione completa: http://www.phgtech.it/2015/06/sakura-fantasy-chapter-1-recensione.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198063165596', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1434056002}
review:
Sakura Spirit had 'plot'.
Sakura Angels also had 'plot'.

Sakura Fantasy, however, has 'plot' and plot.
There's more choices, boobs, 'situations' and the entire game is a much higher standard. The dialogue is better, the audio is better, and getting rid of the usually awkward, invisible male protagonist for another female means more fanservice. Best decision ever.

The lewd/story ratio is excellently balanced, and yuri means +++.

I also need the 2nd chapter. I need to know what happens next. For... reasons.

No-one can judge me. No-one at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073410980', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1600912060}
review:
Offically the first visual novel game I got my hands on, and I'm pretty glad I started with Sakura Fantasy.  It has an amazing story, interesting choices you can make throughout the game and the characters are all so loveable and cute. Not to mention it has some very nice bgm which I use to take a nap with. :3  

Yuri is Love, Yuri is Life. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198089202580', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1437233020}
review:
I'm going to be honest, this is the first VN I have actually played rather than watched videos of on Youtube and, in my faithful opinion, this is one of THE BEST VN's they have made. There are:
-More Choices to pick from
-Wonderful Character and Background Art
- Better Audio
And the list just goes on. This game has brought me out of my hibernation from games. I truly enjoyed reading through this and actually having to think about the multiple choices it gave you. I also went into the extra's screen and found that some of the images were "Locked" so I also hope to backtrack and choose the right decisions to unlock those certain images; I'm aniticipating it already.
I really hope they can release the next chapter very soon beause the storyline was pure beauty, the emotions and feelings I expressed while playing this game were phenomenal. I actually want to know what will happen next in this game. I'm going to check Greenlight every few days now, I really want the next chapter. Will they find the fallen star? Will the slime monster make a second appearance? Who is "She"? So many questions left unanswered is leaving me begging for the truth. Winged Cloud, you have some great potential and I want you, from the bottom of my heart, to carry on making these beautifully designed and created games. Keep up the good work. ;3

author: {'steamid': '76561198006096457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1503080509}
review:
Although short, this is essentially a prelude to the following chapters. 

The story starts off very slow in my opinion, it's more lewd than story for a little while, not that it's a reason to complain. It does pick up and become interesting, while also balancing the perfect-lewd to story ratio, just as the previous stories did. This is clearly going to be much longer, so a slow start isn't surprising. I'm expecting big things. Chapter 2 allegedly set to release late July.

Good art work, wonderful music, gripping story. Very lewd. 7/10

Recommended.

review:
No regrets.

I played the other Sakura Games, this one definately better. It feels alot less contrived, albeit it still pushes the protagonist into 'comprimising' situations quite frequently (more in the second half than first). I enjoyed the actual story (that being: without the yuri parts; enjoyed those too if you know what I mean ;) ) and got frustrated with the protagonist (myself as I like to see it) not trying out a few things with her 'gift' during combat.

Looking forward to the second chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020977186', 'num_games_owned': 5008, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1434831132}
review: Better than the previous Sakura VNs. It's the usual excuse plot business, but it has some meat to it this time around. As opposed to the cardboard cutouts from the previous Sakura VN's, the characters in Fantasy have personalities and motivations that don't revolve around the player character. It's nothing too complicated, but the writing is better than the previous VNs. Unlike in Sakura Spirit, I didn't have to stop every sentence or so to nurse the subdural haematoma that was forming in my brain, which was a plus. Changing to a female protagonist didn't slow the amount of clueless dopes walking in on others changing, but at least one such occasion results in some dialogue that actually has a point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081866568', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1434209267}
review:
So i went into this with low expectations more out of trying something new and this had a very positive (96%) so it seemed a good place to star with a visual novel/anime. i'll start by saying that Sakura Fantasy actually has a suprisingly good and well written story with only an few spelling mistakes and a single instance of "well that was convinient", there is no nudity (at least nothing that wouldnt get past youtube or ofcom) though as ever with alot of anime the characters bodies arent of "realistic" proportions if you catch my drift.
Final Verdict: 10/10
good story, meaningful characters, good control interface, no bugs or crashes and brilliant soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046516052', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1433471867}
review:
Best story of any of the games yet!

This game has very good pacing and a nice story. When playing though, you'll reach the end rather quickly and be left with a massive hole in the story as this game is(was) meant to have a sequel.

This sequel, as of 12/25/17, has still not been released, so if you aren't going to want to play a game with a major plot hole DO NOT BUY. 

Even with this flaw, it is still a very entertaining game and worth the time if you're ever bored.

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198111919936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1434056329}
review:
Before we get on with this review...
Yes i went in it for the boobs and lesbian sex.
I better make this review short since my parents could kick me out at any moment for purchasing this game.
If you're looking for boobs and lesbians being lesbians, then this is the right game for you.
If you're looking for a somewhat decent story that actually makes you somewhat (damn you vines and slime) forget you're playing this boobalicious plot filled game, then this is the right game for you.
If you're looking for chocolate baths, cute girls, sarcastic guardsmen, boobs, and have money to spare, then this is the right game for you.
Honestly, there were times where i enjoyed the non plotfilled scenes and was interested in the situation, environment, and adventure the girls were going on.
But the boobs and partial nudity throughout the game got to be a little overbearing (coming from a lesbian who loves all things boob related) and i couldn't take some scenes seriously, which really dissappointed me.
Overall, i really enjoyed the story and the characters and look foward to the next chapter.
Ok time to pack my things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000459592', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1440971537}
review:
If you're debating whether to get this game or not it comes down to a simple question. Did you buy, play, and enjoy the other Sakura games? (Spirit, Angels). 
If your answer is yes, you can expect to enjoy this game just as much. If no, don't bother.
Great CG's as always and story and dialogue are typical affair of the Sakura series. A nice change in pace with no male MC, and instead having a female MC for yuri pairings. I appreciate alot the extra choices in game despite their insignificance except for grabbing more CG's. It's really the thought of having more control over the story that counts I suppose.
Over all a great grab for fans of the Sakura games like myself, can't wait for the next chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996664052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1433594609}
review: This game basically sets that stage for the second part (to be released next month), so you don't get any major story payoffs here, sadly.  The story isn't horrible for what it is... my biggest complaint, honestly, is that the writing can be so cheesey at parts- like how they constantly mention how so-and-so turned around, making her boobs jiggle slightly, and it comes across as awkward.  Also, I found that the choices I made didn't tend to make much of a difference.  You might make one decision only to find that you're forced to make the other decision anyways!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026565056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1466029778}
review: Sakura Fantasy Chapter 1 is ecchi visual novel. This is the third Sakura in the series and it seems to be a first in the Sakura Fantasy's in an attempt to create a longer story. And the story is is really good so far: you play as Raelin, an aspiring female knight and not a faceless male, who has the special ability to see anyone anywhere. A star falls to earth and you are charged to go retrieve it. Also this game has way more choices than the other two games. The art is pretty much the same. And I give this an 8/10.

review: I thoroughly  enjoyed it from start to finish had a mix of laughs , emotional points , interesting characters and of course its fair share of revealing pics which in my eyes topped the past two games ones and are certainly a nice view. I found and like all the characters and enjoyed finding out about there past and what secrets and all sorts that made them up and even got surprised a little at some points. The decisions are more meaningful and make much more of an impact on the story and can each one can lead you to learn new things, I have only gone through it once and I saw that not all the extra's where ope, this means I am going to be going back through changing the choices up and aiming for them new scenes and new things to learn. Overall loved the game and would recommend to anyone who is fans of the previous games and can't wait for it to continue in future chapters.

review: Reading the other reviews I was kinda expecting PWP (Porn without Plot) and was prepared to be disappointed that I shelled out money for this.. but on the contrary, there's still some substance to this. Yeah, there's still lots of ~plot~ but the actual story isn't too bad either. It does cut off far too early but since this is only chapter one, that's only to be expected. It seems like this would be a great full epic-length VN if you pasted all the chapters together. I'm eagerly waiting for the later chapters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052108016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1433059472}
review:
I'm sure this is a good game for fans of the genre. I bought it on a whim to see whether I'd like the genre. I would have preferred not to write a negative review out of respect to fans and the devs, especially considering all the positive reviews, but after buying just this one game, Steam now thinks I'm a genre fan and is recommending mostly visual novels. So, unfortunately I have to post a negative review in the hopes that Steam will stop doing that.

The artwork is nice. The music is rather well done. As someone unfamiliar with this genre, I found the story very short and childish, but that's probably the point. Interestingly, the engine they used is open source and written largely in Python, and it actually allows for very complex dialogue branching and other functionality, such as complex animation and even video playback. The devs opted not to use most of those functions apparently. I suppose, again, that is standard for the genre.

review:
This game is truly for individuals who have patients and love stories. Of course, if you're not an anime fan, click away. Or should I say, if your not a hentai fan. The characters and the story line is phenomenal, although at times the story if a bit slow. 

What makes this game truly recommendable is the boobs.

 I suggest for the future to implement more story choices to make the game more interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084447404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1458491261}
review: First time playing Sakura series and I really enjoyed it.  I'd recommend it to anyone who likes female protagonists.  While the plot didn't quite hook me in at first, the characters as well as the artwork were really amazing which made me keep on reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085551042', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1433074236}
review:
Sakura Fantasy is quite different from Sakura Angels and Sakura Spirit, because you are playing as a girl and you actually see her on the scene beside other characters. Another difference are decision times, which are much more frequent, which gives you a bit more freedom. It has maybe too much fan service, which sometimes ruin the moment, yet it kind of intensifies the bond between those characters. The story itself will probably really start in chapter 2, since this is kind of foreplay. :P

Still canÂ´t wait for another part :3
Overall rating for me would be 8,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198146779090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1434203519}
review: After playing the previous 2 with this being the third one that I played/read through. I have to say that is has more of a plot compared to the others, you'll also get to make a lot of choices now which is good thing. Really starting to enjoy it now especially since the plot is much bigger this time than just bewbs and the soundtrack is also very well done. Though my favorite in the series is still Sakura Spirit, mainly for nostalgic purposes and the charming characters. This series might actually be as good as it or maybe even better. It's a little weird how they actually reused some of the character models from Sakura Angels but they made quite a few adjustments so that you will be able to think of them as entirely new characters. Definitely recommend this if you are a big fan of the franchise as I am :) I'm currently waiting for Chpater 2 to be released which should be sometime in July as announced by Winged Cloud. There are also rumors that the next 2 games will be called Sakura Dungeon and Sakura Beach. So there is  a lot to look forward to this year from Winged Cloud.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039337300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1441671180}
review:
I liked this! It's been a very enjoyable experience. The art is gorgeous, with many *ahem* assets to admire. The story is better than I thought it would be, but it's still pretty standard fare; it serves its purpose though. The music was also well-done. This is a nice little game, worth the price.

Be aware that it is pretty short. I completed it in about 3 and 1/2 hours. There is some replay value, different scenes to unlock, different choices to make.

I'm looking forward to the next chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102339188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1433314752}
review:
My first time playing one of the Sakura series games wanted to try it out and record it because well I've never played a visual novel game before and I can say the story is very intriguing and I'm enjoying the personalities of the characters so far and the idea of a female knight instead of focusing on a male protagonist, since it's my first time playing a sakura game was hit with an unexpected curve ball at some scenes though xD My first playthrough of it: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gN5i4bAhgGM

author: {'steamid': '76561198152591734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1459344240}
review: The story is AMAZING. At least for me. I am really into the mangas that feature Knights and this is just as good as "Sacred Blacksmith". It is honestly way better then the other previous games. When part 1 ended it left suspense and it made sense. A perfect chapter in itself.  It honestly is a great read accompied by "pleasing" pictures. You have many choices to make and they are relivent (diffrent choices allow for diffrent collectible pictures to unlock. Replay value for the 100%ers out there!) It is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049270028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 97300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1582, 'last_played': 1486950684}
review:
More choices then the previous Sakura games, which thats a change, Sakura Spirit had 1 choice,  Sakura Angels had mabey.... 7 ish? But this one... ohhh boy... ATLEAST in the twenties!. The game is "bigger" and better then the previous ones. And worry not, trading cards should be avaible within the month. And with very little imagination needed, you could imagine them completly naked, for the single leaf or the light beam convering the nipples is easy to do.

8/10
